0.title: Vande Bharat Express hits cow a day after hitting buffaloes, suffers dent; pic surfaces
0.article_body: The Gandhinagar-Mumbai Vande Bharat Express hit a cow near Anand station in Gujarat on Friday, resulting in a dent to the train's nose panel, an official said. On Thursday, the newly-launched semi-high speed train had hit four buffaloes and its nose cone had to be replaced. The incident on Friday took place after around 3.45 pm.

1.title: Govt exam candidates can take test wearing kara, kirpan: Delhi HC
1.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has allowed candidates appearing for Union Government or Delhi government examinations to wear kara and kirpan. The court was hearing a plea filed by the Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee. The court said such candidates must reach the examination venue one hour before the reporting time to help with a search.

2.title: GB Nagar records ₹6-cr rise in liquor sale revenue for September
2.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar recorded an increase of ₹6 crore in revenue from liquor sales this September compared to the month before, officials said. Revenue from liquor sales in September was ₹126.43 crore, while the revenue in August was ₹120.34 crore. District Excise Officer RB Singh said the increase in revenue was due to the reversal of the excise policy.

3.title: QR codes rolled out at B'luru traffic signals for cardiac emergencies
3.article_body: Bengaluru's Manipal Hospitals has installed QR codes at 15 major traffic signals across the city to help people with cardiac emergencies. These codes can navigate people through the correct steps involved in CPR. QR codes to help people connect to emergency number for quick ambulance service have also been installed at signals. The initiative is supported by civic body BBMP.

4.title: K Prabhakar Reddy to be TRS' candidate for Munugode by-election
4.article_body: TRS chief and Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Friday announced K Prabhakar Reddy as the party candidate for the Munugode by-election. The Munugode Assembly seat became vacant after Congress MLA Komatireddy Raj Gopal Reddy resigned on August 8 and joined BJP in presence of Home Minister Amit Shah. The by-elections for the seat will be held on November 3.

5.title: Indore cleanest due to civic workers & citizens, not officials: BJP leader
5.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Friday said the credit for Indore being ranked as the cleanest city in India by Centre's Swachh Survekshan survey must go to 'safai mitras' and citizens instead of officials. "They [citizens] are...cultured and disciplined due to their ancestors," Vijayvargiya said. Indore was followed by Surat and Navi Mumbai in the cleanest city category of 2022.

6.title: Vehicle registrations during festivals doubled compared to 2021: Pune RTO
6.article_body: Vehicle registrations more than doubled in this year's Navratri and Dussehra festivals compared to last year, the Pune Regional Transport Office (RTO) said. From September 26 to October 5 this year, the RTO registered 9,665 vehicles, compared to 4,330 vehicles registered during the festival last year. Of this year's Navratri tally, 5,914 two-wheelers and 2,984 four-wheelers were registered.

7.title: Suryakumar's wife helps him wear Team India blazer ahead of T20 World Cup, MI share video
7.article_body: Mumbai Indians took to Instagram to share a video showing Suryakumar Yadav's wife Devisha helping him wear his Team India blazer ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. "Moment hai, bhai! Moment hai! Good luck, Surya," the caption read. The video also comprised 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag' dialogue that translates to, "You don't just get India's coat, you have to earn it."

8.title: 3 arrested after local cricket match takes violent turn in Pune
8.article_body: Three people have been arrested and a case was filed under IPC Section 307 (attempt to murder) among other offences after a local cricket match took a violent turn in Pune. The arrested allegedly attacked the victim with sticks and a sickle on Tuesday. The arrested accused were identified as Avinash Suresh Sharma, Vikas Simban Gaud and Sagar Bhagwat Warkari.

9.title: Iran denies security forces killed minor, says she fell off roof
9.article_body: Iranian authorities have refuted reports claiming a 16-year-old girl was killed by security forces during protests over Mahsa Amini's death, Iranian media reported on Friday. The minor, Sarina Esmaeilzadeh, committed suicide by falling off a roof, authorities added. Earlier this week, authorities gave a similar cause of death for another girl who was allegedly killed during anti-hijab protests.

10.title: South Africa all-rounder Dwaine Pretorius ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022
10.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Dwaine Pretorius has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup in Australia due to a fracture in his left thumb. Pretorius sustained the injury during the third T20I against India on Tuesday in Indore. Pretorius was the joint-highest wicket-taker for South Africa in the T20 World Cup last year.

11.title: J'khand man set ablaze over inter-community love affair; 11 arrested
11.article_body: As many as 11 people have been arrested for allegedly setting a man on fire over an inter-community love affair in Jharkhand's Dhawaiya village, police informed on Friday. The deceased, who hailed from the Muslim community, was having an affair with a woman from a different community. Local residents attacked him as they weren't happy with this, Bokaro SP said.

12.title: Over 7 kg gold seized from passengers arriving from Dubai at Hyd airport
12.article_body: Hyderabad customs officials have seized 7.6 kg of gold at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. In one case, 4.8 kg of gold worth ₹2.57 crore was seized from a male passenger arriving from Dubai. While in another case, two passengers from Dubai were arrested after customs officials seized 24 gold bars weighing 2.8 kg worth ₹1.47 crore from their check-in baggage.

13.title: No FIR yet against builder for felling 560 trees in Mumbai: Report
13.article_body: Mumbai Police is yet to reportedly file an FIR against a builder group who felled 560 trees illegally on a private plot in Goregaon. The local resident who filed the complaint said the BMC allegedly did not take any action for over a month. The civic body then wrote to the police allegedly confirming that the trees were felled illegally.

14.title: Jharkhand man dies after allegedly being mob lynched in Bengaluru
14.article_body: A man died after allegedly being attacked by a mob on suspicion of being a child-lifter in Ramamurthy Nagar, Bengaluru. The deceased, Sanjay Tudu (33), worked as a mason and was a native of Jharkhand. According to police, it took them eight days to identify the deceased. Notably, six people have been taken into custody for questioning, police said.

15.title: BJP files complaint against Kejriwal, AAP MLA over mass conversion video
15.article_body: BJP on Friday filed a complaint against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and AAP MLA Rajendra Pal Gautam after the latter attended a mass conversion event where around 10,000 people embraced Buddhism. A video showed attendees pledging not to worship Hindu gods and goddesses. BJP accused the leaders of attempting to incite violence and divide India on the basis of religion.

16.title: Mumbai man gets scrap paper after paying ₹3 lakh for US dollars
16.article_body: Thane Police has filed a case against five people who cheated an autorickshaw driver by taking ₹3 lakh from him in lieu of US dollars and then delivering scrap paper. The man from Mumbai's Bhandup was convinced to give the money by one of his female passengers who promised him dollars. The driver was promised 635 notes for his money.

17.title: Man kills father over property dispute in Gurugram; arrested
17.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing his 52-year-old father using his car equipment in Gurugram. "The accused's grandfather had given some land to his father and aunt. He was not happy with this decision and had developed an enmity with his father and aunt," police said. He had frequent quarrels with his father on the matter.

18.title: Abhishek, Rashmika Mandanna condole Arun Bali's demise
18.article_body: Several celebrities took to social media to express condolences on the demise of veteran actor Arun Bali. Abhishek Bachchan tweeted, "Very sad to hear of the passing of Arun Bali Ji...A wonderfully warm and loving man. Had...pleasure to share screen space with him on several films." Rashmika Mandanna, who worked with Arun in his last film 'Goodbye', wrote, "Truly saddened."

19.title: Delhi Police arrest 2 men involved in terror activities
19.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police has arrested two men for their alleged involvement in terror activities, an officer said on Friday. One of them was wanted in connection with the RPG attack on Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in May this year. The second accused has been arrested in connection with the recovery of an IED in Haryana in August.

20.title: Pune fire dept issues new number after helpline develops technical glitch
20.article_body: After the 101 emergency number of the Pune fire brigade developed technical glitches, the fire department issued a new helpline number. People can now call on 020-26451707 in case of any fire emergency. "The 101 emergency number of the bridge is dysfunctional now, and it gives out some recorded messages regarding insurance companies," an official of the fire brigade said.

21.title: Former South African Prez Zuma set free after prison term ends
21.article_body: South Africa's former President Jacob Zuma has been released from jail upon the expiration of his prison sentence for contempt of court, South African authorities said on Friday. Zuma received a 15-month prison term last year after he ignored instructions to participate in a corruption inquiry. He surrendered on July 7 last year to begin his sentence.

22.title: I'm follower of Lord Ram, haven't tampered with history: 'Adipurush' maker
22.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut addressed the criticism that his film has been receiving and said that he is a big follower of Lord Ram and has "done nothing wrong in this film". "We have not tampered with history, and I would call this history, our proud history. We kept the purity of this history while working on this," Om added.

23.title: Police seek Forest Dept's help after python spotted in Hyd graveyard
23.article_body: Hyderabad's Chatrinaka Police have sought Forest Department's help to catch a python which was found crawling in Quadri Chaman graveyard in Falaknuma. Police want to safely shift the snake to a forest. This comes after a video of the python moving from one grave onto another surfaced online. It has reportedly been spotted in the graveyard for about one week.

24.title: India raises objection as US envoy visits Pak-occupied-Kashmir, calls it 'Azad J&K'
24.article_body: The Indian government has raised an objection over the recent visit to Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir (PoK) by the US ambassador to Pakistan Donald Blome. Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the objection has been conveyed to the US. Blome had, during the recent visit, repeatedly referred to the region as 'Azad Jammu and Kashmir'.

25.title: Iranian coroner rules out blows to body as cause of Amini's death
25.article_body: An Iranian coroner's report into the death of Mahsa Amini has ruled out blows to the head and limbs as the cause of her death, Iran's state media reported on Friday. The coroner's report said that Amini died from multiple organ failure caused by cerebral hypoxia. She fell while in custody due to "underlying diseases", the report added.

26.title: Massive fire breaks out at Noida factory, several fire tenders reach spot
26.article_body: A massive fire broke out on Friday at a factory in Noida's sector 3 following which several fire tenders reached the spot. The fire reportedly broke out at a factory for manufacturing plastic trays used in modular kitchens. Spot visuals showed thick black smoke emanating from the building and efforts to douse the fire are ongoing.

27.title: What is Myasthenia Gravis, the rare autoimmune disease Arun Bali was suffering from?
27.article_body: Veteran actor Arun Bali, who passed away on Friday, was suffering from Myasthenia Gravis. It's a rare neuromuscular disease in which weakness of skeletal muscles happens. This happens when communication between muscles and nerve cells becomes impaired due to certain deficiencies in chemicals. Symptoms include double vision, difficulty in speaking, chewing, swallowing and difficulty in walking.

28.title: Rahul Gandhi should undertake 'Congress Jodo Yatra': UP BJP chief
28.article_body: Uttar Pradesh BJP chief Bhupendra Singh Chaudhary on Friday advised Rahul Gandhi to undertake a 'Congress Jodo Yatra'. Rahul Gandhi should have started his 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Pakistan's Peshawar, Karachi or Islamabad, Chaudhary said. "It was during the Congress government that partition of the country took place. After that, there has been no division," Chaudhary added.

29.title: Two men arrested for trying to snatch gold chain in Thane
29.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly trying to snatch a gold chain from a man in Thane, Maharashtra. The accused, Rashid Ansari (24) and Vasim Rais Shaikh (20), tried to snatch it from a 26-year-old man near the Anjurphata railway bridge before the victim resisted the attempt, police said. The accused also attacked the victim with a knife.

30.title: FIR against two MP Congress MLAs for allegedly harassing woman in train
30.article_body: An FIR was registered against Madhya Pradesh Congress MLAs Siddharth Kushwaha and Suneel Saraf for allegedly harassing a woman in a train. The victim said they forced her to have a meal with them and one of them held her hand when she refused. Kushwaha, however, said he only exchanged his berth with her and had no conversation with her.

31.title: It referred to sanctions: Ukraine on Zelenskyy's 'preventive strike' remark
31.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was referring to imposing sanctions on Russia when he suggested preventive strikes were necessary to preclude any use of nuclear weapons, his spokesperson, Serhii Nykyforov, said. The hints at the use of nuclear weapons were "afforded only by the terrorist state Russia. You will never hear such calls from Ukraine", Nykyforov added.

32.title: Flipkart spent $1.1 billion in 6 months: Walmart filings
32.article_body: Flipkart spent $1.1 billion in cash between February 1 and July 31 this year, parent company Walmart's filings with the US Securities and Exchange Commission showed. The company's cash and cash equivalents fell from $2.2 billion at the end of January 2022 to $1.1 billion at the end of July 2022. Flipkart's spending was on mergers, acquisitions and capital expenditure.

33.title: West needs to build strong deterrence to keep Kremlin at bay: Lithuania
33.article_body: Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda on Friday said the West must build strong deterrence in its support of Ukraine to make sure that Russia doesn't want to risk expanding the war. "We've to be strong and not let us [be] manipulated because...Kremlin regime is very good at that," Nauseda added as he arrived in Prague for an EU summit.

34.title: Google to invest $690 million in Japan, open its 1st data centre in the country
34.article_body: Google is planning to invest $690 million in Japan through 2024, its CEO Sundar Pichai told Nikkei on Friday. Google will open a data centre in Chiba Prefecture near Tokyo in 2023, its first in Japan, for faster access to Google's services. Japan will be the third data centre location in Asia after Taiwan and Singapore.

35.title: At least 705 absentee doctors still drawing money from government: Tejashwi
35.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav claimed that at least 705 government doctors are still getting their monthly salaries even though they have been absent from work for more than six months. He said that many doctors posted in rural areas didn't work there and instead continued to practice in urban areas. He has announced to take strict action against them.

36.title: Delhi hospital uses over a century-old procedure to treat Iraqi man's leg
36.article_body: Doctors at a Delhi hospital here treated a 40-year-old Iraqi national's leg using the cross-leg flap surgery which is an over a century-old technique, reports said. The doctors at Fortis Hospital, Vasant Kunj, decided to perform the procedure as the newer ones were not feasible considering his health. A doctor said that the leg is recovering well.

37.title: Pic of MS Dhoni's wax statue in Mysore goes viral, fan asks 'Where is MS Dhoni?'
37.article_body: A picture of MS Dhoni's wax statue in Mysore has gone viral on social media. Several fans stated that the statue doesn't resemble Dhoni, with one tweeting, "Where is MS Dhoni?" Renowned cricket writer Jarrod Kimber wrote, "That's a big no from me." Other tweets read, "The guy in the red looks like Dhoni than the statue" and "Burn it".

38.title: Friends couldn't believe it: Gajraj on playing Madhuri's husband in Maja Ma
38.article_body: Actor Gajraj Rao, who plays Madhuri Dixit's husband in 'Maja Ma', revealed that when he told his friends about his role in the film, they "couldn't believe it". "They [asked], 'Gajju, are you sure...you've been paired alongside Madhuri Dixit as her husband? You are her hero!' I told them it's not a hero-heroine story. It's a family story," Gajraj said.

39.title: After Elon Musk revived Twitter deal, Tesla shares fell nearly 2%
39.article_body: After Elon Musk decided to revive his Twitter offer earlier this week, Tesla shares fell by 1.8%. The stock has lost 34% since the Tesla CEO first disclosed a stake in Twitter on April 4. Musk has already offloaded over $15 billion of Twitter's stock this year and according to Bloomberg, he holds 465 million shares as of August 9.

40.title: Mukarram Jah Trust to restore 6th palace of the Nizam of Hyderabad
40.article_body: The sixth palace of the Nizam of Hyderabad located in Purani Haveli premises will be renovated by the Mukarram Jah Trust for educational purposes, a press release from the palace said. "The infrastructure will also have a sports arena inside the Purani Haveli premises...to [provide] coaching and training facilities to girls," MA Faiz Khan, Trustee of Mukarram Jah Trust, said.

41.title: US accuses Russia of exploiting African resources to fund war in Ukraine
41.article_body: The US has accused Russian mercenaries of exploiting natural resources in Central African Republic, Mali, Sudan and other areas to fund Ukraine war. "People across Africa are paying heavy price for Wagner Group's exploitative practices and human rights violations," US Ambassador to UN, Linda Thomas-Greenfield, told UN Security Council. Wagner fought in Libya, Syria and Mali, among other countries.

42.title: Hope it helps release him: Belarus opp'n as Bialiatski wins Nobel prize
42.article_body: The Nobel Peace Prize to Belarusian human rights activist Ales Bialiatski recognises Belarusians who stood up to authoritarian leader Alexander Lukashenko, opposition spokesman Franak Viacorka said. "This prize will help...attract attention to political prisoners...Bialiatski is one of them. He's kept in inhuman conditions and we hope it will help...release him and thousands of others," he added.

43.title: Bharti Airtel stock gains after rollout of 5G services in 8 cities
43.article_body: A day after Bharti Airtel launched its 5G services in eight cities across India, for which customers will have to pay as per their existing 4G plan, its stock gained on Friday. Global brokerage firm, Morgan Stanley has an 'overweight' stance on the company and expects a further 4.6% upside in its shares to ₹825 apiece from Thursday's closing price.

44.title: Pics show aerial view of US' Florida before and after Hurricane Ian's approach
44.article_body: NASA shared satellite images showing aerial view of US' Florida before and after the approach of "extremely dangerous" Hurricane Ian. "Turquoise colour is likely sediment that Ian lifted from...seafloor," said NASA. Prior to the storm, there was already some colour, but much of that is due to light reflecting off sea grass beds, seafloor and coral reefs, it added.

45.title: Wasn't trying to look sexy: Doja to troll calling her gold look 'ugly'
45.article_body: Rapper-singer Doja Cat replied to a troll who called her gold look at Paris Fashion Week 'ugly'. "The paint is making her look ugly...She looks like...tired old statue," the user tweeted. Doja replied, "I wasn't trying to look sexy or attractive...All of my makeup has...story and there are absolutely 0 rules and if there were you wouldn't be...one making them."

46.title: Real development of northeast began after Modi became PM: Amit Shah
46.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah claimed that the real development of northeast region of India began only after Modi took over the office of Prime Minister in 2014. "In the 75 years of independence, before Narendra Modi became PM, the northeast was considered only a tourist destination...The government has decided to set up around 65,000 active [agricultural societies]," said Shah.

47.title: 250 acres in Global City project will be auctioned by November: Haryana CM
47.article_body: The Haryana government is planning to auction 250 acres of land for the proposed Global City in Gurugram by November this year. CM Manohar Lal Khattar claimed that 13 Dubai-based companies are likely to invest in it. "Plots will be sold in a mixed land use format and size will vary from 100 acres to 5 acres," said the CM.

48.title: BEST plans to have a fleet of 5,000 e-bikes at bus stops by 2023
48.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) plans to have a fleet of 5,000 e-bikes at bus stops across Mumbai for last mile connectivity by 2023. "These vehicles can be picked up and dropped off at any e-bike station," Lokesh Chandra, General Manager of BEST, said. "This...strengthens BEST's position as the country's number one technology-oriented transport undertaking," he added.

49.title: Leopard enters Maha house in bid to chase dog, forest officials cage it
49.article_body: A leopard reportedly entered a house in a Maharashtra village in a bid to chase down a dog. The owner of the house locked the house from the outside, reports said. The forest officials were then called, after which, efforts to cage the leopard were initiated. The leopard was caught after four hours.

50.title: 7 out of 8 RRTS stations in Ghaziabad to have footbridges
50.article_body: Seven out of the eight Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) stations in the Ghaziabad district will have footbridge facilities for passengers and regular pedestrians, the National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) has said. The 82-km-long RRTS project, pegged at ₹30,274 cr, will link Delhi, Ghaziabad and Meerut with a high-speed train network with a design speed of 180 km/h.

51.title: Police and fans clash during soccer match in Argentina; 1 dead
51.article_body: At least one person died amid clashes between police and soccer fans on Thursday during a local tournament match in Argentina. The person died of a heart problem, an official said. According to authorities and witnesses, police fired tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse a crowd of home team fans trying to make their way into a packed stadium.

52.title: Who is Ales Bialiatski, this year's Nobel Peace Prize winner?
52.article_body: Jailed Belarusian human rights activist Ales Bialiatski is among three winners of the Nobel Peace Prize this year. The 60-year-old is the Founder of the Viasna (Spring) Human Rights Centre, set up in 1996, which supported jailed protesters and documented the use of torture by authorities against political prisoners. President Alexander Lukashenko's regime has detained him without trial since 2020.

53.title: Punjab's youngest MLA Narinder Kaur Bharaj marries AAP worker
53.article_body: Narinder Kaur Bharaj, the 28-year-old Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Sangrur, got married to a 29-year-old party worker named Mandeep Singh Lakhewal at a gurdwara in Patiala on Friday. Sharing a picture from the wedding ceremony, MLA Amarinder Singh Raja Warring congratulated the couple on social media. Bharaj, a law graduate, is the youngest MLA in the Punjab Assembly.

54.title: 5 persons booked for housing society fraud of ₹82 lakh in Thane
54.article_body: Five persons, including an official of state cooperative department, were booked for their alleged involvement in misappropriating funds of ₹82 lakh of a housing society in Thane, police said. "Other accused are civil and electrical contractors who were given various works," police added. A probe is underway and no arrests have been made so far, police said.

55.title: 3 killed as speeding car rams into parked truck in Assam's Kamrup
55.article_body: At least three persons were killed after a speeding car hit a parked truck near Sonapur in Assam's Kamrup Metropolitan district on Thursday night, police said. The car was going towards Guwahati when it hit the truck on NH-37, police added. Earlier, three members of a family were killed after a four-wheeler and a truck collided in Biswanath in September.

56.title: Multilevel flyover construction delayed due to traffic issues in Pune
56.article_body: The work on multilevel flyover at the Pune University junction has been delayed due to the traffic issues that are being caused by the construction of another multilevel flyover at Chandani Chowk. "PMC requested to postpone the work due to traffic issues. The work will start next week but before that...we have convened a meeting of officers," an official said.

57.title: Ukraine's preventive strike comments justify our military operation: Russia
57.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's remarks suggesting NATO should launch preventive strikes on Russia confirmed the need for what Moscow calls its "special military operation" in Ukraine. Zelenskyy told an Australian think tank that he believed strikes were necessary to prevent any use of nuclear weapons.

58.title: Rapido driver asks for rider's phone to make call, runs away with it in Mumbai
58.article_body: A Rapido driver reportedly fled with a rider's phone in Mumbai. A 17-year-old student had booked the bike taxi to Opera House on Monday. When he asked the driver to stop midway for a minute, the latter asked for his phone to make an urgent call. Before the boy realised, the driver sped away on his scooter with the phone.

59.title: God put you in power: Russian Orthodox leader to Putin on his 70th b'day
59.article_body: The head of the Russian Orthodox Church Patriarch Kirill wished Russian President Vladimir Putin on his 70th birthday on Friday. "God put you in power so that you could perform a service of special importance and of great responsibility for the fate of the country and the people entrusted to your care," the patriarch said.

60.title: Gautam Adani to invest ₹65,000 cr in Rajasthan, create 40,000 jobs
60.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani will invest ₹65,000 crore in Rajasthan over the next five to seven years and create more than 40,000 direct and indirect jobs. Adani said his group has already invested over ₹35,000 crore across multiple sectors in Rajasthan. Adani Group also achieved commercial operations of the world's largest wind-solar hybrid power plant in Rajasthan, he added.

61.title: India lose a women's international cricket match against Pakistan after more than 6 years
61.article_body: Pakistan defeated India by 13 runs in their Women's Asia Cup T20 2022 match on Friday. Pakistan put up a total of 137/6 and dismissed India for 124. This is the first time in more than six years that Pakistan have defeated India in women's international cricket. Further, it is India's first defeat in Women's Asia Cup T20 2022.

62.title: Man sets woman on fire for rejecting marriage proposal in J'khand
62.article_body: A man was arrested after he allegedly set a 22-year-old woman on fire for rejecting his marriage proposal in Jharkhand's Dumka. "[The accused] had entered [the woman's] home on Friday morning, poured petrol on her when she was asleep and set her ablaze," a sub-divisional police officer told PTI. The accused is already married, the sub-divisional police officer said.

63.title: 3 miscreants fire at man standing outside his home in Gurugram
63.article_body: At least three miscreants allegedly shot at a man while he was standing outside his home in Gurugram's Arjun Nagar, police said. The firing took place in connection with liquor smuggling, police added. The attackers came from both sides of the street riding two scooties and fired at him and ran away, the victim's mother said.

64.title: Arrested driver in Bandra-Worli Sea Link accident had 28 challans: Report
64.article_body: Irfan Abdul Raheem Beelkia, the driver who has been arrested for killing five people and injuring several others in an accident on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link, has had 28 e-challans against his vehicle. Unpaid challans amount to ₹28,800, reports said. Officers reportedly added that the accused had been fined for overspeeding on the Sea Link five days before the incident.

65.title: Orcas caught chasing, killing great white shark on video for the first time
65.article_body: Scientists have confirmed that orcas hunt great white sharks, after drone and helicopter footage showed first evidence of a pod of orcas killing a great white near Mossel Bay in South Africa. The footage shows five killer whales chasing the sharks in an hour-long pursuit, before killing one of them. Researchers believe that three other sharks may also have been killed.

66.title: 11 arrested in Faridabad for cheating 1,398 people across 26 states
66.article_body: Faridabad Police on Thursday arrested 11 members of a gang for allegedly cheating 1,398 people across 26 states. Police recovered six mobile phones, three SIM cards, 19 debit cards, eight chequebooks and ₹25,300 from them. "The fraud came to light after a Faridabad woman was cheated of ₹39,000 on September 20 after she received a new credit card," police said.

67.title: Man who undressed himself before woman walking her dog arrested in Mumbai
67.article_body: A 32-year-old man, booked for behaving indecently in front of a 23-year-old college student in south Mumbai, was arrested on Wednesday after 100 days of investigation. On June 17, the accused allegedly undressed himself in front of the woman when she was walking her dog below the Kennedy Bridge and behaved indecently. Later, an FIR was registered against him.

68.title: Comedian Judy Tenuta, also known as 'The Love Goddess', dies of ovarian cancer at 72
68.article_body: Stand-up comedian Judy Tenuta, also known as "The Love Goddess" passed away aged 72 on Thursday in Los Angeles. Her longtime manager, Roger Paul, said the cause was ovarian cancer. She rose to national fame with a comedy special on HBO in 1987, 'Women of the Night', in which she starred alongside Ellen DeGeneres.

69.title: Luxury yacht owned by sanctioned Russian oligarch docks in Hong Kong
69.article_body: A luxury yacht belonging to sanctioned Russian oligarch Alexey Mordashov has docked in Hong Kong waters. Mordashov was among a number of Russian oligarchs sanctioned by the European Union and the US after Russia invaded Ukraine. The megayacht Nord, worth over $500 million, arrived in Hong Kong on October 5 after travelling for over a week from Russia's Vladivostok.

70.title: Aaditya was enjoying at Swiss pub when Uddhav was hospitalised: MP
70.article_body: MP Rahul Shewale has accused Maharashtra's former Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray of enjoying himself at a pub in Switzerland when his father, Uddhav Thackeray, was hospitalised in May. Aaditya had visited Switzerland to inaugurate the Maharashtra Pavilion at the World Economic Forum. Recently, former CM Uddhav Thackeray said rebel Shiv Sena leaders betrayed him when he was hospitalised.

71.title: Speed limit for Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway set at 120 km/hr
71.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a speed limit for the Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway. Vehicles can run at a speed of 100 to 120 km/hr. However, entry of two-wheelers, rickshaws and four-wheeler rickshaws has been barred on the expressway. The government also announced that the goods carrier vehicles can only run at a maximum speed of 80 km/hr.

72.title: 'Indians largest group that overstays visa,' says UK minister; India responds
72.article_body: Indian-origin UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman has said that the Migration and Mobility Partnership signed between India and UK last year hasn't "worked well". She said Indians were the "largest group of people who overstay" their visas in the UK. Reacting to her remarks, the Indian High Commission said the comments "may not be appropriate" as negotiations are underway.

73.title: Documentary on director SS Rajamouli in the works: Reports
73.article_body: A documentary on filmmaker SS Rajamouli is in the works, as per reports. The documentary, which pays an ode to the filmmaker and traces his journey and the laurels that he has brought to our industry, went on floors this week in Hyderabad, a source quoted by the report said. Rajamouli is currently working on a film with Mahesh Babu.

74.title: Man booked for abetting 24-year-old wife's suicide in Thane
74.article_body: A man was booked after his 24-year-old wife died by suicide due to alleged harassment in Thane, Maharashtra. The accused allegedly used to beat his wife and also threatened to divorce her, the deceased's father said in his complaint. The deceased hanged herself in her house on September 23, police said. Notably, no arrest has been made so far.

75.title: Beware of 5G fraudsters duping people on pretext of upgrading SIMs: Hyd Police
75.article_body: Hyderabad Police has warned the citizens of fraudsters duping people on the pretext of upgrading their SIMs to 5G services. Several complaints of people losing money from bank accounts after responding to unsolicited links received on phones have been reported ever since the news of 5G rollout came out. "We urge...public to not respond to any such messages," police said.

76.title: Ukraine promises 'life' & 'safety' to Russian troops who lay down arms
76.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Friday called on Russian troops to lay down their arms, promising them "life and safety". "You can still save Russia from tragedy and the Russian army from humiliation," Reznikov said in Russian in a video addressed to Russian troops. He further said that Russian troops have been "deceived and betrayed" by the Kremlin.

77.title: Indian crypto exchange ZebPay seeks Singapore permit, assesses UAE
77.article_body: India-based cryptocurrency exchange platform ZebPay has applied for a licence in Singapore and is assessing the potential of a similar step in the UAE, outgoing CEO Avinash Shekhar told Bloomberg. "The 1% transaction tax the nation imposed on crypto this year is hurting trading volumes," he said. Shekhar added that ZebPay implemented salary cuts, including 6% drop for non-management staff.

78.title: Adidas puts partnership with Kanye West's Yeezy under review
78.article_body: Adidas on Thursday said it has put its partnership with rapper Kanye West's Yeezy brand under review. The decision was taken "after repeated efforts to privately resolve the situation", the company said, adding, "We...recognise that...successful partnerships are rooted in mutual respect and shared values." Kanye, now known as Ye, responded to the news and said Adidas "stole" his designs.

79.title: Happy b'day to someone always on energy saving mode: Yuvraj to Zaheer
79.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to wish ex-Team India pacer Zaheer Khan on his 44th birthday, terming him as someone who is "always on energy saving mode". "Wishing you a day as wonderful as you are brother! Lots of love always," added Yuvraj in his tweet. "Happy [birthday] Zak...Lots of love," read a tweet from Harbhajan Singh.

80.title: Vedanta Chairman to seek shareholders' nod to use firm's cash reserves
80.article_body: Billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal's Vedanta Resources Limited will seek the approval of Vedanta Limited's shareholders on October 11 on a company plan to move money out of its reserves and into its balance sheet. The move will increase the probability that the funds will be used for dividends. London-based Vedanta Resources uses dividends from its Indian unit to repay debts.

81.title: Video shows Anushka getting annoyed at photographers allegedly clicking Vamika's pics
81.article_body: A video shows actress Anushka Sharma getting annoyed at photographers for allegedly clicking pictures of her daughter Vamika at the airport. After noticing that photographers were recording videos, she gestured at them to stop. A photographer is heard saying, "We aren't taking Vamika's pictures." She posed with cricketer-husband Virat Kohli after he ensured that Vamika was out of the frame.

82.title: Scan a QR code, get token to make OPD registration in Delhi hospitals
82.article_body: A faster OPD registration service has been launched at Delhi government hospitals. To use the service, people must scan the QR code placed at OPD registration counters and fill in details like their name, age, address, mobile number etc. A token will be sent to their phones which can be used to collect their outpatient (OP) slip for doctor consultation.

83.title: Bhagwat’s speech aimed at 'unleashing communal animosity': Kerala CM
83.article_body: Reacting to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat’s community-based population imbalance remark, Kerala CM P Vijayan alleged that it was a false propaganda aimed at "unleashing communal animosity" in the country. Earlier on Wednesday, Bhagwat had said that the nation should frame a comprehensive population control policy applicable to all social groups equally and flagged the issue of demographic imbalance.

84.title: 9-member task force formed to monitor cheetahs in Kuno National Park
84.article_body: The central government has constituted a nine-member task force for monitoring cheetahs in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park and other areas. The team will also monitor the hunting skills and adaptations of the cheetahs. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi had said, "A decision will be taken after a few months and then you will be able to see the cheetahs."

85.title: Peace Nobel awarded to Ales Bialiatski, 2 human rights organisations from Russia, Ukraine
85.article_body: The Norwegian Nobel Committee on Friday awarded the 2022 Nobel Peace Prize to human rights advocate Ales Bialiatski from Belarus, the Russian human rights organisation Memorial and the Ukrainian human rights organisation Center for Civil Liberties. "They have for many years promoted the right to criticise power and protect the fundamental rights of citizens," the Norwegian Nobel Committee said.

86.title: Completely false: Xiaomi on report of moving India operations to Pakistan
86.article_body: Xiaomi has denied a report claiming that the Chinese electronics maker may move its India operations to Pakistan after the government froze its assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore. Xiaomi said the report is "completely false and baseless". The company added, "99% of our smartphones & 100% of our TVs are made in India. We'll take all measures to protect our reputation."

87.title: FIR filed against owners of buffaloes hit by Vande Bharat Express
87.article_body: The Railway Protection Force in Gujarat registered a case against the owners of buffaloes that were hit by the Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express, officials said on Friday. The nose cone cover of the driver coach of the train, which got damaged after hitting the buffaloes, was replaced with a new one in Mumbai. Four buffaloes were killed in the incident.

88.title: US consulate in Hyd to auction laptops, 2-wheelers, TVs; full list shared
88.article_body: US consulate in Hyderabad is going to conduct an online auction for four-wheelers, two-wheelers, televisions, IT equipment and other items. A tweet shared by the consulate listed all the things that will be auctioned. The list includes queen mattress, table lamp, multiple dining chairs, television, television cabinet, book cases, CPUs, monitors and other things.

89.title: I lose out on a lot as I am Lionel Messi, my children suffer: Messi
89.article_body: Lionel Messi said he loses out on a lot due to his identity as a popular footballer, adding his children "suffer". "We forbid ourselves from doing many things. It would be nice to have a moment alone with your family," he stated. Talking about shifting to Paris in 2021, Messi said, "I remember leaving...[my kids] at school and...suffering for them."

90.title: US' largest retailer Walmart to lay off 1,458 workers in Atlanta
90.article_body: Walmart is planning to fire 1,458 workers at the e-commerce fulfilment centre in Atlanta. The company's spokesperson, Scott Pope, said affected workers are being assisted with paid job searches and some employees have been re-hired at other Walmart stores. Earlier on Thursday, Walmart announced that it would acquire a robotics and automation firm, Alert Innovation, to help speed up deliveries.

91.title: India operations effectively halted: Xiaomi to HC on $676-mn assets freeze
91.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Thursday declined to lift a freeze on Xiaomi's assets worth $676 million. Xiaomi denied any wrongdoing and said it "is severely disproportionate and has effectively halted the operations" in India. Enforcement Directorate had in April ordered the seizure of Xiaomi India's assets for illegally remitting foreign exchange outside India under the guise of royalty payments.

92.title: Villagers lynch man who allegedly raped 9-yr-old girl in Bihar
92.article_body: Villagers lynched a man who allegedly raped a nine-year-old girl in Bihar's Katihar on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred when the villagers apparently caught the man red-handed and brutally assaulted him after tying him to a tree. The villagers reached the scene after hearing the girl cry out for help while the man raped her, an investigating officer said.

93.title: US sanctions Myanmar businessmen over Russian arms deals
93.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on a Burmese company and its owners for allegedly procuring Russian-made weapons and aircraft from Belarus for the Myanmar military junta that seized control of the country in last year's coup. Along with the owners of Dynasty International, Aung Moe Myint and Hlaing Moe Myint, the company's Director, Myo Thitsar, was also sanctioned.

94.title: Credit Suisse to buy back $3 billion debt to reassure investors
94.article_body: Credit Suisse on Friday said it will buy back up to 3 billion Swiss francs ($3 billion) of debt to reassure investors. The move trims the debt burden of the Switzerland-headquartered bank even as its shares touched a record low on October 3 to 3.52 Swiss francs ($3.7). The bank has lost about 60% of its market value this year.

95.title: Police officer demands ₹5 lakh extortion money in Pune; booked
95.article_body: Pune's Vimantal police have filed a case against a police officer for allegedly demanding ₹5 lakh extortion money from a petrol pump owner for the smooth functioning of his business. According to the complaint, the incident took place in September and the accused apparently threatened the petrol pump's owner with "dire consequences" if he failed to pay the money.

96.title: He somehow cleared class 12, only wanted to play cricket: Patidar's father
96.article_body: Batter Rajat Patidar's father Manohar Patidar said he wasn't interested in anything else apart from cricket, adding that he somehow managed to clear Class 12. "His movement was restricted from home to the ground (for practice)," he stated. Reacting to Rajat receiving his maiden Team India call-up for the ODI series against South Africa, Manohar said, "It is very normal."

97.title: Woman finds pencil in Burger King meal in UK; shares pic as staff tell her 'Not to worry'
97.article_body: A woman found a pencil in her Burger King meal in UK's Bootle. Leanne Daly shared a pic of the pencil that she found in her burger after staff at the Burger King outlet told her "not to worry". "We apologise for the impact this incident has caused and have investigated the matter raised," a spokesperson said.

98.title: Ola, Uber, Rapido's auto services declared illegal in B'luru, ordered to discontinue
98.article_body: Karnataka Transport Department has issued notices to cab aggregators like Ola, Uber, and Rapido, ordering them to discontinue their auto services in Bengaluru, calling it illegal. The development comes after complaints of aggregators charging ₹100 for a 2 km auto ride. "Submit an explanation about illegal autorickshaw operation...within 3 days. If not, legal action will be taken," the notice said.

99.title: Dabur India stock falls after it expects Q2 margin to be hit
99.article_body: Dabur India's stock traded lower on Friday, a day after the FMCG major said in its business update for the September quarter that the geopolitical environment continued to have a high inflationary impact on its business. Dabur said its operating margin could be 150-200 basis points lower year-on-year. Its shares were trading 1.87% lower on the BSE at 11:10 am.

100.title: Global economy moving towards greater uncertainty: IMF chief
100.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Kristalina Georgieva said that the global economy is moving from a world of relative predictability to one of greater uncertainty. She warned that about one-third of the world economy will experience at least two consecutive quarters of contraction. IMF in July slashed its growth forecast for this year to 3.2% and to 2.9% for 2023.

101.title: Upset over 14-yr-old son's suicide after being scolded, Chennai man kills self
101.article_body: A 40-year-old man died by suicide after his son killed himself in Chennai. The 14-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide after being scolded by his father over playing mobile games. The son took the step when he was alone in the house. The man locked himself in a room after finding out about his son's death and died by suicide.

102.title: 2 youths saved from getting washed away in U'khand; video surfaces
102.article_body: Two youths from Uttar Pradesh were saved from getting washed away in a river at Sharda Ghat in Uttarakhand's Tanakpur by a swimmer of the state police and a local youth, police tweeted on Thursday. The police also shared a video of the incident, which shows the swimmer and the local youth bringing the duo to the shore.

103.title: US & South Korea hold maritime drills after North Korea's missile launch
103.article_body: The US and South Korea held joint maritime drills on South Korea's east coast, country's Joint Chiefs of Staff said. The drills, involving a US aircraft carrier, come after North Korea launched ballistic missiles into the sea on Thursday and flew warplanes near the border with South Korea. The US, Japan and South Korea recently held trilateral missile defence exercises.

104.title: 2 killed, 6 wounded after man goes on stabbing spree along Las Vegas Strip
104.article_body: At least two people have been killed and six others have been wounded after a man armed with a large kitchen knife went on a stabbing spree along the casino-lined Las Vegas Strip in the US on Thursday, officials said. The suspect, who was described as a Hispanic man in his 30s, was taken into custody soon after the attack.

105.title: 3 more bodies recovered, death toll reaches 19 in Uttarkashi avalanche
105.article_body: At least three more bodies were recovered from the site of an avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, the Nehru Institute of Mountaineering (NIM) said on Friday. The death toll has now climbed to 19, it added. While 17 of these bodies are of trainee mountaineers, two are of their instructors, it further said.

106.title: 500 raids in 3 months, nothing found: Kejriwal as ED raids 35 sites
106.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday reacted to Enforcement Directorate (ED) carrying out searches at around 35 locations in connection with the Delhi excise policy case, alleging that all the officials "are trying to find proof against...[Deputy CM Manish Sisodia]". "Over 500 raids, more than 300 CBI/ED officials have been working 24x7 for three months...Nothing has been found," he added.

107.title: 27-year-old wanted criminal arrested after shootout in Noida Film City
107.article_body: A 27-year-old criminal, identified as Danish who is wanted in multiple cases, was arrested following a shootout in Noida Film City on Friday, police said. "A police check was set up near Brahmaputra Market...Danish was intercepted...he fled the spot. Nearby police posts were alerted about the development," police added. An associate of Danish who was with him escaped, police stated.

108.title: India announce their playing XI for women's Asia Cup 2022 match against Pakistan
108.article_body: Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof won the toss and elected to bat first against India in their women's Asia Cup 2022 match. India captain Harmanpreet Kaur is back in the playing XI, replacing KP Navgire, while Radha Yadav has replaced Sneh Rana. India are currently the only unbeaten side in the tournament.

109.title: New Zealand PM invites PM Modi for a visit, says ties growing stronger
109.article_body: New Zealand PM Jacinda Ardern invited PM Narendra Modi to visit the island nation and said that the relationship between both countries has been growing stronger. "Both nations care for...democratic traditions and share an interest in a peaceful and prosperous Indo-Pacific region. We share concern for climate change and have similar passions for celebrating different cultures," added Ardern.

110.title: RTO starts drive against older petrol and diesel vehicles in Noida
110.article_body: The transport department in Noida has launched a drive to phase out all petrol vehicles older than 15 years and diesel vehicles older than 10 years. "We will ask all such vehicle owners to get their vehicles scrapped or get a no-objection certificate (NOC) for other districts where the air quality is better," said an officer.

111.title: 74-yr-old Indian-American man shoots dead daughter-in-law in US parking lot, arrested
111.article_body: A 74-year-old Indian-American man, Sital Singh Dosanjh, was arrested for fatally shooting his daughter-in-law Gurpreet Kaur Dosanjh at a parking lot in California, US. Gurpreet had seen Sital driving in the lot of the Walmart where she worked, indicating that he travelled 241km to find her, her uncle said. She was in the process of divorcing Sital's son, he added.

112.title: New Vande Bharat Express damaged after hitting buffaloes repaired within 24 hours
112.article_body: The new Vande Bharat Express damaged after hitting buffaloes while running between Mumbai Central and Gujarat's Gandhinagar has been repaired within 24 hours. "The nose cover is designed to absorb the impact without transmitting the same to the functional parts of the train. Therefore, it is sacrificial by design and hence replaceable," an official said.

113.title: Far-right US group Proud Boys' member admits to seditious conspiracy
113.article_body: A member of far-right group in the US, Proud Boys, has pleaded guilty to plotting with other members to stop the transfer of presidential power after the 2020 election. Jeremy Joseph Bertino participated in planning the riots and received encrypted messages indicating storming the Capitol, authorities said. "We're on cusp of saving the constitution," Bertino had written on social media.

114.title: 2022 FIFA World Cup will surely be my last: Lionel Messi
114.article_body: Seven-time Ballon d'Or winner Lionel Messi has said that the upcoming 2022 FIFA World Cup will "surely" be his last. "I'm counting down the days to the World Cup. There is anxiety and nerves at the same time. Wanting it to be now, what is going to happen, and ultimately, how is it going to go?" Messi stated.

115.title: Spanish university male students shout vulgar threats at women; PM Sanchez reacts
115.article_body: A Spanish university dormitory said on Thursday that it has expelled several male students caught on video yelling vulgar threats at female students in a neighbouring block. Reacting to the video, Spain's Prime Minister Pedro Sanchez said actions that "generate hate and threaten women" would not be tolerated, adding, "It's especially painful to see the protagonists are young people."

116.title: 50-yr-old woman raped, kicked in private parts by 2 policemen in Jharkhand
116.article_body: A 50-year-old woman was allegedly raped by two policemen while she was in a field to cut grass in Jharkhand's Lohardaga district, police said. "The two policemen took turns to rape her and also kicked her in the private parts, which led to excessive bleeding," the complaint said. The woman sustained serious injuries and is currently undergoing treatment.

117.title: Amazon shuts down field tests of home delivery robot Scout
117.article_body: Amazon is ending field tests of its home delivery robot Scout as the program did not completely meet customers' needs, the company said on Thursday. The e-commerce firm started testing Scout on sidewalks outside Seattle in 2019. Employees working on Scout will be offered new roles, an Amazon spokesperson said, adding that the company was not abandoning the project altogether.

118.title: Pune City Police arrests man for cheating 200 people over fake loans
118.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a man who cheated about 200 persons in Maharashtra over fake instant loans. The accused used to tell victims to transfer ₹4,000- ₹5,000 as "processing fee", police said. "The accused used to leave home...telling (his) family that he has got a job, but used to...cheat people by posting fake advertisements on social media platforms," police added.

119.title: Man taking joyride at Dussehra fair electrocuted to death in Ludhiana
119.article_body: A 22-year-old man was allegedly electrocuted to death while taking a joyride at a Dussehra fair in Ludhiana on Wednesday. A few other people also said they felt a slight electric shock. However, the caretaker of the ride denied the electrocution claim and said the victim vomited, fell on the ground and later died of cardiac arrest.

120.title: US advises citizens against travelling to Pakistan, cites 'terrorism & violence'
120.article_body: The US has urged its citizens to reconsider travel to Pakistan, especially its restive provinces including Balochistan and Khyber Pakhtunkhwa (KPK) provinces. "Reconsider travel to Pakistan due to terrorism and sectarian violence. Some areas have increased risk," the US State Department said. "Terrorists may attack with little or no warning," the advisory stated.

121.title: Binance-backed blockchain probes $100 million token theft
121.article_body: Binance-backed blockchain, BNB Chain, has launched an investigation into a potential theft of between $100 million and $110 million worth of digital tokens native to the network. A BNB Chain developer said on Reddit that the issue has been contained and user funds are safe. However, the developer also mentioned that about $7 million of stolen funds have been frozen.

122.title: Fitness equipment maker Peloton to fire 500 employees
122.article_body: US-based exercise equipment maker Peloton has said it is planning to layoff about 500 employees. Peloton's CEO Barry McCarthy said if the company can't turn itself around in about six months, it might not be a viable standalone company. He later clarified that his reported statement was at odds with the story he told and the state of the business.

123.title: Man charged with smuggling 3 pythons in his pants across US-Canada border
123.article_body: A 36-year-old man has been charged with allegedly smuggling three Burmese pythons in his pants at a US-Canadian border crossing. Calvin Bautista is accused of bringing the hidden snakes on a bus that crossed into northern New York in July 2018. Importing Burmese pythons is banned in the US as the species is considered "injurious to human beings".

124.title: Deficiencies at Biocon's Bengaluru drug plant listed by European body
124.article_body: The European Directorate for the Quality of Medicines & HealthCare (EDQM) has listed out deficiencies related to Biocon's API (active pharma ingredient or bulk drug) manufacturing site in Bengaluru after an inspection, the company said in a filing on Thursday. The Bengaluru-headquartered company said that while no deficiencies were marked as critical, one was listed as major.

125.title: Samsung's quarterly profit falls for first time in nearly 3 years
125.article_body: Samsung Electronics reported a 32% drop in quarterly operating earnings on Friday. Its estimated profit fell to 10.8 trillion won ($7.67 billion) in July-September, which is the first year-on-year decline in nearly three years, the company said in a preliminary earnings release. The slump was driven by a fall in demand for electronic devices and the chips that power them.

126.title: Sanju Samson can hit 6 sixes in an over like Yuvraj Singh: Steyn
126.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn said Sanju Samson has the same potential as ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh, adding he can hit six sixes in an over like Yuvraj did. "As soon as Kagiso Rabada bowled that no-ball in the last ball of his over, I was like, 'Please don't let this happen'...You never know with someone like Samson," stated Steyn.

127.title: BJP fixed only 73 government schools in Gujarat over 27 years: Sisodia
127.article_body: Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia, who is set to visit government schools in Gujarat, said BJP fixed only 73 government schools over 27 years. "At this rate, it'll take BJP 15,000 years to fix 40,800 Gujarat government schools," he added. "These days, whenever Arvind Kejriwal and I visit Gujarat, people show us schools with...no facilities for their children," Sisodia stated.

128.title: Mashal Sports announces vivo PKL Season 9 from 7th Oct, 7:30 pm onwards
128.article_body: Mashal Sports initiative vivo Pro Kabaddi League announced that Season 9 is all about #FantasticPanga. The aim of this season is to celebrate the fans who will be returning to the stadiums after 3 years. Starting 7th October, 7:30 pm onwards, the season will take place in Bengaluru, Pune and Hyderabad.

129.title: Man who kidnapped, murdered Indian-origin family in US once worked for them: Relative
129.article_body: The man who kidnapped and murdered an Indian-origin Sikh family, including an eight-month-old baby girl, had once worked for the family's trucking business, a relative said. Jesus Manuel Salgado had a longstanding dispute with them that got "pretty nasty", according to authorities. The family, originally from Hoshiarpur, Punjab, was kidnapped in Merced County, California.

130.title: 2 Russians sail to US' Alaska to avoid Putin's military draft, seek asylum
130.article_body: Two Russian men sailed to US' Alaska in a small boat to avoid being drafted to fight in Ukraine, US authorities said. The men, who'd made the 300-mile journey from Egvekinot to St Lawrence Island in Alaska, have been detained and are seeking asylum in the US, they added. Russian President Vladimir Putin announced a partial military mobilisation last month.

131.title: Truck carrying devotees overturns as brakes fail near Pune; 13 hurt
131.article_body: At least 13 devotees were injured after a truck in which they were travelling overturned near Pune on Thursday. The incident occurred after the truck's brakes failed while negotiating a slope in Shindawane Ghat and the vehicle skidded in loose soil when the driver tried to stop it, an officer said. The devotees suffered minor injuries, the officer added.

132.title: 4 of family injured as 24-yr-old drunk motorist hits 2-wheeler in Mumbai
132.article_body: Four people from a family were injured after a 24-year-old man, who was driving under the influence of alcohol, crashed into their two-wheeler in Mumbai. The motorist was driving on the wrong side of the road, reports said. A 40-year-old man and his 35-year-old wife sustained fractures in the incident. Meanwhile, their two children sustained head injuries.

133.title: NCB seizes drugs worth ₹120 crore from Gujarat, Mumbai; 6 arrested
133.article_body: The Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB) seized MD drugs worth ₹120 crore from Gujarat and Mumbai, officials said on Friday. About 50 kg drugs concealed in a godown in Mumbai were recovered, while over 10 kg drugs were seized in Gujarat's Jamnagar. A former Air India pilot was among those arrested, according to an NCB official.

134.title: 50% of work on Ram Mandir in Ayodhya completed: Yogi Adityanath
134.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath has confirmed that 50 percent of the work on the under-construction Ram Mandir in Ayodhya has been completed. "Dedicated efforts were made to realise the dream of Ram Mandir, for which the movement started in 1949," said the CM. Earlier in August 2020, PM Modi laid the foundation stone for the construction of the temple.

135.title: ED summons DK Shivakumar & his brother in money laundering case
135.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has summoned Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar and his brother DK Suresh to its Delhi office in a money laundering case today. Earlier, Congress leaders had requested the agency to give them time in view of the "Bharat Jodo Yatra." However, ED rejected the request to extend the date of their appearance.

136.title: Noida resident thrashes guard after altercation over dog; both held
136.article_body: A housing society's resident and a security guard were arrested after an altercation allegedly broke out between the two over a dog and the former thrashed the guard in Noida on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred after the resident's wife asked the guard to remove the dog from the common area but he refused, a police spokesperson said.

137.title: Spirit of cricket has become redundant: Hogg on Chahar's 'mankad' warning
137.article_body: Reacting to Deepak Chahar warning Tristan Stubbs about 'mankading' in the third T20I between India and South Africa, ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg tweeted, "Batter breaks the law, bowler doesn't use the law." "No disappointment about the batter's action...We don't accept [the] umpire's decision with [the] use of DRS as well...'Spirit of cricket' has become redundant," added Hogg in his tweet.

138.title: 3 top ISIS terrorists killed in separate US military operations in Syria
138.article_body: The US military on Thursday said it has killed three senior Islamic State (ISIS) leaders in two separate operations in Syria. Among those killed was Abu-Hashum al-Umawi, deputy leader of ISIS militant group in Syria and one of the top five most senior ISIS members worldwide. The airstrikes are the first known US operations in a government-held area in Syria.

139.title: Tesla Semi's production started, PepsiCo to get 1st delivery: Musk
139.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk on Thursday announced that the production of Tesla Semi truck has started and PepsiCo will receive the first deliveries starting December 1. The all-electric truck, which was first unveiled in 2017, was supposed to go into production within two years. PepsiCo had placed an order for 100 Semi trucks soon after the truck was launched.

140.title: Mob enters heritage madrasa, performs puja in Karnataka; 9 booked
140.article_body: Nine people were booked and four were reportedly arrested on Thursday after a mob allegedly entered Mohamud Gawan Madrasa in Karnataka's Bidar and performed puja, police said. The mob was a part of a  Dussehra procession. The madrasa, built in 1472 AD, is a heritage building maintained by the Archaeological Survey of India. A video of the incident surfaced online.

141.title: Former WWE wrestler Sara Lee passes away aged 30
141.article_body: Former WWE wrestler Sara Lee has passed away at the age of 30. "As a former "Tough Enough" winner, Lee served as an inspiration to many in the sports-entertainment world. WWE offers its heartfelt condolences to her family, friends and fans," WWE tweeted. The cause of her death has not been disclosed.

142.title: Mukesh Ambani, Asia's 2nd-richest man, to open family office in Singapore: Report
142.article_body: Mukesh Ambani, Asia's second-richest man and Chairman of Reliance Industries, is setting up a family office in Singapore, Bloomberg reported. Ambani has appointed a manager to hire staff for the new entity and also chosen real estate, the report said. Ambani, who currently has a net worth of $83.7 billion, reportedly wants the office to be running within a year.

143.title: US blacklists 13 more firms over alleged ties to China's military
143.article_body: US Department of Defense has blacklisted 13 more Chinese companies, alleging they have ties with China's military. DJI Technology, the world's largest manufacturer of consumer drones, and BGI Genomics are among the firms that have been blacklisted. The companies have been added to a list that bars US entities from buying or selling publicly traded securities in target companies.

144.title: US President Biden pardons thousands of Americans convicted of marijuana possession
144.article_body: US President Joe Biden took executive action to change US policy on marijuana, pardoning all prior federal offenses of simple marijuana possession. "There are thousands...who've prior federal convictions for marijuana possession, who may be denied employment, housing, or educational opportunities," Biden said. "My action will help relieve collateral consequences arising from such convictions."

145.title: BBMP to resume demolition drive after Dussehra break
145.article_body: Bengaluru's civic body BBMP will resume its demolition drive to remove encroachments in the city from Monday, after the Dussehra break. "The JCBs (earth movers) will be taken to demolish homes and other structures from Monday according to the relevant laws," said BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath. Notably, the city saw waterlogging and flooding in August and September.

146.title: India reports 1,997 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 30,362
146.article_body: India reported 1,997 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 2,529 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 30,362. The coronavirus-related death toll so far has reached 5,28,754 following nine fatalities in the last 24 hours.

147.title: I fell short by 2 shots: Samson after India's loss in 1st ODI vs SA
147.article_body: Sanju Samson said he "fell short" by two shots in the first ODI between India and South Africa which the former lost by nine runs. "I knew if I had to get 24 runs in the final over, I can hit four sixes," added Samson. Samson scored 86* off 63 balls with his knock comprising nine fours and three sixes.

148.title: 2 youths invited for meeting in Delhi killed due to envy over Insta followers
148.article_body: Three juveniles, including one girl, were apprehended for allegedly killing two youths in Delhi. Reports said that the girl and one of the deceased used to envy each other over the number of followers they had on Instagram. The victims were reportedly invited to meet by the accused, after which, they were killed. They died during treatment at the hospital.

149.title: Video shows men going near tiger in MP forest for pics; IFS officer says 'never do this'
149.article_body: A video showing men going near a tiger to take its pictures and videos in Panna Tiger Reserve in Madhya Pradesh has surfaced online. IFS officer Parveen Kaswan tweeted, "No animal want trouble including these massive tigers. All they want is space. Friends never do this." "The tiger can maul you to death feeling threatened," wrote IFS officer Susanta Nanda.

150.title: Clerk suspended over Ravana effigy not burning properly in Chhattisgarh
150.article_body: A municipal clerk was allegedly suspended after the effigy of Ravana didn't burn properly in Chhattisgarh's Dhamtari during Dussehra celebrations. The city's municipal commissioner issued an order to suspend the clerk citing "serious negligence" in preparing the effigy, according to reports. The order, which was reportedly issued on Thursday, stated that this tarnished the municipal body's image.

151.title: ED raids 35 locations in Delhi, Punjab in Delhi excise policy case
151.article_body: Enforcement Directorate is carrying out searches at around 35 locations in Delhi and Punjab in connection with the Delhi excise policy case. The searches are underway at premises linked to liquor businessmen, distributors and supply chain networks. Notably, Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia is among the people named as accused in CBI's FIR in the case.

152.title: Kolkata Puja immerses Durga idol in artificial tank for 1st time in 190 yrs
152.article_body: A 190-year-old Kolkata Puja immersed its Durga idol in an artificial tank for the first time. This was reportedly done in a bid to keep pollution in check. A four feet high tank, which was six feet in diameter, was used for the immersion. Reports said that the tank was equipped with two jet sprayers.

153.title: 4 officials suspended after drug peddler escapes custody in Patiala
153.article_body: Four officials of Patiala Central Jail were suspended days after a drug peddler named Amrik Singh escaped from custody. DSP (Security) Varun Sharma posted for prison security, Assistant Superintendent-cum-Warrant Officer Harbans Singh, Jail Warder Satpal Singh and Mandeep Singh have been suspended," an official spokesperson said. Amrik Singh was taken to a hospital from where he escaped.

154.title: All that remains is hanging: Chidambaram on police caning men in Guj
154.article_body: After a video showed police in Gujarat's Kheda publically caning men, Congress leader P Chidambaram on Thursday said, "First, bulldozing. Now, flogging. All that remains is hanging." The men who were being caned had allegedly pelted stones at a garba event. "In UP, Assam and now in Gujarat, the state police has become Judge, Jury and Hangman," he added.

155.title: Hyderabad zoo gets new attractions as it completes 59th year
155.article_body: Hyderabad's Nehru Zoological Park completed the 59th year of its formation on Thursday. A pair of meerkats and a pair of white-eared marmosets were added to the list of attractions. Officials also unveiled an open fish pond with varieties of fish. A cub of an Asiatic lioness was named 'Adhiti' by RM Dobriyal, Principal Chief Conservator of Forests, Telangana.

156.title: Prince Harry, Elton John sue UK media group over privacy breaches
156.article_body: Britain's Prince Harry and singer Elton John are among several public figures suing the publisher of Daily Mail newspaper over alleged phone tapping and other breaches of privacy. The others involved in the legal action are actresses Elizabeth Hurley and Sadie Frost, Elton John's husband and filmmaker David Furnish, and Doreen Lawrence, the mother of murder victim Stephen Lawrence.

157.title: Priyanka Chopra shares post on Iran anti-hijab protests over death of 22-year-old
157.article_body: Amid anti-hijab protests in Iran over the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini in the custody of Iran's morality police, Priyanka Chopra wrote, "The voices that speak after ages of forced silence, will rightfully burst like a volcano...I stand with you." "Add your voice to this critical movement," Priyanka added. Amini was arrested on September 13 in Tehran for "inappropriate attire".

158.title: Won't attend India-Pakistan match in T20 World Cup 2022, I get into fights: Ramiz Raja
158.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja has said he won't attend India-Pakistan match at T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. He stated he doesn't watch Pakistan's matches from stadiums as he gets into fights with people. "People are inviting me to attend the first match of World Cup, but I will watch the matches sitting at home," he added.

159.title: Mumbai to witness moderate rains with thunderstorms in next 2 days: IMD
159.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted light to moderate rainfall with thunderstorms over Mumbai in the next couple of days. "All India severe weather warnings have been issued by IMD for the coming 5 days…Northern parts of Raigad district, Navi Mumbai, Ratnagiri, ghat areas of Pune and Satara have the possibilities of moderate thunderstorms," said the IMD official.

160.title: Rupee falls to record low of 82.16 against US dollar
160.article_body: The rupee declined to a record low of 82.16 against the US dollar on Friday. It had closed at 81.89 on Thursday. The dollar index, which tracks the American currency against a basket of six major peers, was at 112.032 following a rally after a two-week low. Benchmark indices Sensex and Nifty opened in the red amid weak global cues.

161.title: Electronics Mart India shares trading at 60% premium in grey markets
161.article_body: Electronics Mart India Limited's shares are trading at a premium of nearly 60% over the upper price band in grey markets, analysts said. The ₹500-crore public offer opened for bidding on October 4 and the price band was set at ₹56-₹59 per share. On Thursday, which was the second day of offer, the IPO was subscribed 7.57 times.

162.title: Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk halted to allow $44 billion deal to close
162.article_body: Twitter's lawsuit against Elon Musk over his $44 billion purchase of the company has been halted to allow the parties more time to close the deal. If the transaction isn't completed by October 28, new trial dates will be set, Delaware Chancery Judge Kathaleen McCormick said. Musk has proposed to buy Twitter for the original price of $54.20 per share.

163.title: Uttar Pradesh should be pothole-free by November 15: CM Yogi to officials
163.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered a statewide campaign and directed officials to make the state pothole-free by November 15, the CM's office said. This comes following a high-level meeting held on Thursday. "Good roads and better connectivity are everyone's rights," he said. CM Adityanath also reviewed the preparations for the 81st session of the Indian Road Congress (IRC).

164.title: Man claims Flipkart sent iPhone 14 instead of iPhone 13 to customer; shares pics
164.article_body: A Twitter user has claimed that Flipkart sent iPhone 14 to one of his followers who had ordered iPhone 13 on the e-commerce platform. The man shared pictures of the order summary and the product received by the customer. While several people on Twitter called the customer 'lucky', a user wrote, "So even Flipkart knows it's the same phone."

165.title: Gang of women surround woman on Gurugram road, steal purse with ₹15000
165.article_body: A gang of women dressed in white sarees allegedly stole another woman's purse which had ₹15000 cash, her phone and documents like PAN and Aadhaar card. The incident took place when the accused women surrounded the victim on a road in Gurugram amid the Dussehra rush. "All of the suspects dispersed immediately after the theft," police said.

166.title: US Prez Biden pardons thousands convicted of marijuana possession
166.article_body: US President Joe Biden on Thursday pardoned all people with federal convictions for "simple possession" of marijuana. There are thousands of people who've prior federal convictions, who may be denied employment, housing or educational opportunities, and this move would relieve such "collateral" consequences, Biden said.  "No one should be in jail just for using or possessing marijuana," he added.

167.title: 22 kids killed by gunman in mass shooting at Thailand daycare were sleeping
167.article_body: The 22 kids who were killed by a gunman in mass shooting at a daycare in Thailand were sleeping, according to Piyalak Kingkaew, who led the rescue team that was the first to arrive. "Nobody wants this to happen. It's a scene that nobody wants to see. It's harrowing," Kingkaew added. The attacker later killed himself.

168.title: B'luru to get 4 multi-speciality hospitals, 243 Namma Clinics: CM
168.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai on Thursday said that four multi-speciality hospitals and 243 Namma Clinics will be set up in Bengaluru. "20 PHCs (primary health centres) will also be upgraded. ₹500 crore has been earmarked to provide cochlear implantation free of cost for the poor," he added. Bommai inaugurated a 50-bed subcentre of the Jayadeva Institute of Cardiology.

169.title: Man who impersonated woman on social media arrested in Gr Noida
169.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested in Greater Noida for allegedly setting up fake social media accounts impersonating his female friend and posting inappropriate pictures, police said. The accused had befriended the woman six years ago but she got married to someone else, a police official said. "[The accused] also called...[woman's] husband and hurled abuses at him," the police official added.

170.title: Nuclear 'Armageddon' risk highest since 1962, Putin is not joking: US President
170.article_body: US President Joe Biden has said that the risk of nuclear 'Armageddon' is at the highest level since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis. "[Russian President Vladimir Putin] is not joking when he talks about potential use of tactical nuclear weapons or biological and chemical weapons," Biden warned. The threat from Putin is real "because his military is...significantly underperforming", he added.

171.title: IMD issues moderate rainfall warning for Pune for next 2 days
171.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Thursday issued a warning for moderate rainfall over Pune and its neighbouring areas for the next two days. Pune and other districts will witness thunderstorms, lightning and rainfall till October 8, it added. "Due to (a) cyclonic circulation, moisture-laden winds...being pulled from the Arabian Sea and Bay of Bengal over Maharashtra," an official said.

172.title: Started rescuing but there was little we could do: U'khand avalanche survivor
172.article_body: Naib Subedar Anil Kumar, a survivor in Uttarakhand avalanche incident that took place on October 4, said that the avalanche unhooked three to four ropes and those who were anchored to the ropes fell into the crevasse. "When the snow began to settle...I undid ropes and started to rescue my teammates. However, there was little we could do," he said.

173.title: Pune man makes hoax call about plot to kill PM to frame neighbours
173.article_body: A 38-year-old man was arrested from Pune's Dehu road area after he made a hoax call claiming that a plot was being hatched in a flat to kill PM Narendra Modi. The accused allegedly made the call to "teach a lesson" to his neighbours as he was annoyed by the noise made by their children, a police official said.

174.title: Veteran actor Arun Bali passes away aged 79
