174.article_body: Veteran actor Arun Bali, who has worked in films like '3 Idiots', 'PK', 'Kedarnath' and 'Panipat', passed away at the age of 79 on Friday, news agency ANI reported. He was diagnosed with a rare neuromuscular disease called myasthenia gravis in January this year. Bali's last film 'Goodbye', starring Amitabh Bachchan and Neena Gupta, is set to be released today.

175.title: India abstains from voting at UNHRC on holding debate on China's treatment of Uyghurs
175.article_body: India on Thursday abstained from voting at UN Human Rights Council (UNHRC) on holding a debate on China's treatment of Uyghur Muslims in Xinjiang. The draft resolution on "holding a debate on the situation of human rights in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China" was rejected after 17 members voted in favour, 19 members voted against and 11 abstentions.

176.title: Two 17-yr-old boys stabbed to death in Delhi, 3 minors apprehended
176.article_body: Police apprehended three minors after two boys aged around 17 were stabbed to death in Delhi's Mukundpur. A 17-year-old girl who lives in the neighbourhood called the victims on Wednesday night, police said. The girl was with her brother and two friends, and when the victims reached the spot, an altercation took place between the two sides, police added.

177.title: Women engage in fight, pull each other's hair in Thane local; video surfaces
177.article_body: An argument between two women on board Thane-Panvel local train turned violent after they started thrashing each other. A video of the incident that reportedly took place on Wednesday evening has surfaced on social media. The women are seen pulling each other's hair and raining slaps on each other in the video.

178.title: 60-yr-old woman dies after falling into open drain in Delhi's Dwarka
178.article_body: A 60-year-old woman fell into an open drain in Delhi's Dwarka on Wednesday, police said. The incident took place at around 7:00 pm in Sector 13 near a Reliance Fresh outlet. The woman, identified as Sudha Devi, was taken to a hospital where she passed away, police said. A case has been registered for causing death by negligence.

179.title: ₹8.81 crore fine collected from traffic violators in Gurugram till August 2022
179.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police said they have collected ₹8.81 crore as fines from around 8 lakh traffic violators between January and August this year. As per police, most of these challans have been issued for driving in the wrong direction, followed by for driving without high-security number plates, no entry, excess seating capacity, dangerous driving, using black films etc.

180.title: Clear Dalit sanitation workers' dues worth ₹16 cr: Delhi L-G to AAP govt
180.article_body: Delhi L-G VK Saxena on Thursday directed the Chief Secretary to clear all dues of Dalit sanitation workers before Diwali. The order came after Dalit Indian Chamber of Commerce and Industry cited non-payment of bills to over 1,000 workers to the tune of ₹16 crore by Delhi government. The workers have reportedly not received their dues over last four years.

181.title: Credit Suisse is seeking outside investor for investment bank spin-off: Reports
181.article_body: According to reports, Credit Suisse is trying to bring an outside investor to provide funds for a spin-off of its advisory and investment banking businesses. The bank is looking for advisory and deal-making teams alongside the leveraged finance unit for its new boutique-like firm. Sources said talks on reviving the First Boston name for the spun-out businesses are also advancing.

182.title: Nykaa joins hands with Dubai's Apparel Group for strategic alliance
182.article_body: Indian cosmetics brand Nykaa entered a strategic alliance with Dubai-based lifestyle brand Apparel Group to expand in Gulf countries. Nykaa Chief Executive Falguni Nayar said the two companies will together build a multi-brand beauty retail business in Gulf Cooperation Council countries. Nykaa said that the upcoming festival season has already given a glimpse of consumer demand recovery.

183.title: Govt gets ₹1,203 crore dividend from 5 Central Public Sector Enterprises
183.article_body: The government has received ₹1,203 crore as dividend tranches from five Central Public Sector Enterprises (CPSE). The total dividend receipts of the government from CPSEs now stand at ₹14,778 crore in this fiscal. Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey tweeted that SAIL, HUDCO and IREL paid ₹604 crore, ₹450 crore and ₹37 crore respectively.

184.title: Sanju Samson smashes his highest score in ODI cricket
184.article_body: Sanju Samson on Thursday slammed an unbeaten 86 off 63 deliveries in the first ODI against South Africa in Lucknow. It is Samson's highest score in ODI cricket. The 27-year-old wicketkeeper-batter's previous highest score was 54(51), which came against West Indies in July. In his seven ODI innings, Samson has crossed 40 four times.

185.title: False: Tharoor on rumours of him backing out of Congress Prez poll
185.article_body: MP Shashi Tharoor on Thursday stated that rumours of him withdrawing his nomination from the Congress President election are false. "I'm receiving so much support that if I wouldn't have been democratically inclined, I would have asked the other candidate to withdraw," he added. He called the election a "friendly contest". Mallikarjun Kharge is the other candidate for the post.

186.title: I picturise Ravana like this: Adipurush director on comparison of his Ravana with Khilji
186.article_body: Director Om Raut has defended the portrayal of Ravana in 'Adipurush' after many compared Saif's look to Ranveer Singh's Khilji in 'Padmaavat'. Raut said, "The Ravana that we saw earlier was an artistic representation of the evil that Ravana was. My Ravana is demonic too, but in today's time, if I picturise Ravana like this, then that is it."

187.title: 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' becomes fastest film in history to gross ₹100 crore in Tamil Nadu
187.article_body: Mani Ratnam-directorial 'Ponniyin Selvan 1' has created history by becoming the fastest film to gross ₹100 crore in Tamil Nadu box office. The film crossed the ₹100 crore mark in Tamil Nadu within five days of its release, breaking the previous record of seven days set by 'Sarkar' and 'Bigil'.

188.title: Harshad Ribadiya joins BJP days after resigning from Congress
188.article_body: Patidar community leader Harshad Ribadiya joined the BJP on Thursday, two days after resigning from the Gujarat Assembly as a Congress MLA. He was inducted during a function organised at the BJP's state headquarters 'Kamalam'. Several local Congress leaders, including Junagadh district Congress President, Mehsana taluka Congress President and Kisan Morcha leaders, also joined BJP during the event.

189.title: 22 killed as two migrant boats sink off the coast of Greece
189.article_body: Two boats carrying illegal migrants sank off the coast of Greece late on Wednesday night, resulting in the death of at least 22 people with many missing. The two vessels sank hundreds of miles apart. Rescue efforts in one of the incidents saw residents and firefighters pulling out migrants from the edge of steep cliffs.

190.title: 16 killed, 24 injured in bus accident in Nepal
190.article_body: At least 16 people were killed and 24 people were injured in a bus accident in southern Nepal's Bara District on Thursday. At the time of the accident, the bus was transporting people from the Dashain festival in Narayangadh in Chitwan district to Pathlaiya in Bara district. According to reports, the bus was carrying more passengers than its capacity.

191.title: Sonia, Rahul help girl after she falls during Bharat Jodo Yatra
191.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi and Rahul Gandhi helped a girl who fell down during the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka's Mandya on Thursday. Sharing a video of the incident, Congress tweeted, "We care!" The video, which has gone viral on social media, shows Sonia Gandhi giving a back rub to the girl. The child bore a Tricolour in her hands.

192.title: Don't kill or get killed, contribute to Kashmir's development: Athawale to terrorists
192.article_body: Union minister Ramdas Athawale on Thursday appealed to terrorists to neither kill nor get killed and instead contribute to the development of Kashmir. "Kashmir is a beautiful place...The government is trying to boost tourism so that it creates more employment opportunities and benefits the people," he said. He added that Pakistan-Occupied Kashmir (PoK) would be part of India "one day".

193.title: Javed Akhtar's 'World needs you in White House' tweet to Michelle goes viral, people react
193.article_body: A tweet by lyricist Javed Akhtar telling ex-US First Lady Michelle Obama that "not only US but the world needs you in White House" went viral. Reacting to it, a user wrote, "What the covfefe is this." Another tweet read, "The confidence I need in...life." "Reminds me of Lalit Modi telling Sushmita Sen to 'reply my SMS'," a user wrote.

194.title: India abstains from voting at UN to debate China's abuse against Uyghur Muslims
194.article_body: India has abstained from voting on a draft resolution in the UN Human Rights Council to debate the human rights situation in China's Xinjiang region. The draft resolution on "holding a debate on the situation of human rights in the Xinjiang Uyghur Autonomous Region of China" was rejected after 17 members voted in favour, 19 voted against, and 11 abstentions.

195.title: India lose an ODI on home soil for 1st time in 2022
195.article_body: South Africa defeated India by 9 runs in the rain-curtailed first ODI in Lucknow on Thursday. With this, India suffered their first defeat in ODI cricket on home soil in 2022. South Africa put up a total of 249/4 in their 40 overs and restricted India to 240/8. The match witnessed Sanju Samson register his highest ODI score (86*).

196.title: Hinduphobia has no place in our society: UK's Labour Party leader
196.article_body: UK's Opposition Labour Party leader Keir Starmer has said "Hinduphobia has absolutely no place in our society", as he vowed to end "divisive politics" in the country. "I want to...thank the Hindu community for your contribution to Britain, for everything you do for us," he said. Starmer's comments came following recent communal clashes in Leicester and Birmingham.

197.title: Oil prices at 3-week high as OPEC+ cuts production by 2 mn barrels/day
197.article_body: Oil prices jumped to three-week high on Thursday after Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries and its allies agreed to cut oil production by two million barrels/day. Brent crude futures jumped by 0.9% to $94.25 per barrel, while US West Texas Intermediate crude was up 0.9% at $88.55 per barrel. Reportedly, the production cut will go into effect from November.

198.title: Tiger enters MANIT campus; classes shifted to online mode
198.article_body: A tiger entered the campus of Maulana Azad National Institute of Technology (MANIT) in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh on Thursday, forcing classes to be held in the online mode. MANIT Registrar Binod Doley said the Forest Department officials had spotted the tiger's pugmarks. He said cages were set up and cameras were installed to monitor the tiger's movements.

199.title: 3 gather on hilltop for online study, struck by lightning in Odisha
199.article_body: Three school students aged between 17-18 were struck by lightning on Wednesday after they gathered on a hilltop for online study owing to poor internet connectivity at Mundagam village, Odisha. Their parents found them in an unconscious state on the hilltop near Mundagam. They're currently in a hospital. Kandhamal's Chief District Medical Officer Manoj Upadhyay said their condition is stable.

200.title: Bihar man tied to tree, beaten to death by villagers for raping 9-yr-old
200.article_body: A man in Bihar's Katihar was tied to a tree and beaten to death by villagers for allegedly raping a nine-year-old girl. The accused silently took the girl to an isolated spot while she was sleeping with her mother in her house. He was caught red-handed when the girl's mother and villagers reached the spot after hearing her cries.

201.title: 3 to 4 farmers commit suicide in Maharashtra everyday: Ajit Pawar
201.article_body: Former Maharashtra minister Ajit Pawar on Thursday claimed three to four farmers were committing suicide in the state everyday since the new government led by CM Eknath Shinde came to power. He further accused the government of not declaring a wet drought in some parts of the state. The Nationalist Congress Party leader was addressing a gathering in Baramati.

202.title: Cattle movement curbs to continue in view of lumpy skin disease: Maha minister
202.article_body: Maharashtra Animal Husbandry Minister Radhakrishna Vikhe Patil on Thursday said that restrictions on cattle movement in Maharashtra will continue for one more month in view of the lumpy skin disease. "Vaccination is going on and we are assessing the situation," Vikhe Patil said. "This vaccination drive has helped us keep the deaths to 2,100," he added.

203.title: 'Cataclysmic' pair of stars that orbit each other in less than an hour discovered
203.article_body: Astronomers have discovered a pair of stars with an extremely short orbit that appear to circle each other every 51 minutes. The system could be a "cataclysmic variable," in which a sun-like star orbits tightly around a white dwarf, a hot, dense core of a burned-out star. In next 70 million years, their orbital period would reduce to 18 minutes.

204.title: Man stabbed after dispute over alleged molestation of girls at garba event in Rajasthan
204.article_body: A man was stabbed after a dispute over alleged molestation of girls during a garba program in Bikaner in Rajasthan, ANI reported. According to Bikaner Police, two accused named Gautam and Sameer Nadsa were arrested while a minor was also detained on the complaint of Madhusudan Modi. The victim is currently in ICU in PBM hospital, reports said.

205.title: BRS has no plans to contest K'taka Assembly polls: HD Kumaraswamy
205.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy on Thursday said that Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS), led by Telangana CM KCR, has no intention to contest Assembly polls in Karnataka. BRS may support JD(S) in "15-20 Telugu-speaking" Assembly constituencies in Karnataka bordering Telangana, Kumaraswamy said. Kumaraswamy ruled out any intention to go to national politics and said his strength and fight is in Karnataka.

206.title: AAP releases 4th list of 12 candidates for Gujarat elections
206.article_body: The Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Thursday released its fourth list of 12 candidates for the Gujarat Assembly elections. The party has nominated a retired teacher named Nirmalsinh Parmar from Himatnagar and businessman Doulat Patel from Gandhinagar (South). An industrialist named Kuldeep Vaghela, tribal leader Pankaj Patel and an arts teacher named Dinesh Baria are also included in the list.

207.title: Reflections from Mars not caused due to water: Scientists
207.article_body: Scientists have said that reflections on the surface of Mars under its south pole could be caused by layers of ice and carbon dioxide and not by water. "On Earth, reflections that are bright are often an indication of liquid water, even buried lakes...But on Mars...it should be too cold for similar lakes to form," a researcher said.

208.title: Magna to invest over $120 million for new engineering centre in Bengaluru
208.article_body: Canadian auto parts maker Magna said that it has planned to invest over $120 million to establish a new engineering centre in Bengaluru. Magna said that the facility will serve as a key centre in powertrain electrification, electronics and software-defined vehicle development. The facility is expected to open in the first quarter of next year.

209.title: Heard 'GodFather' is doing well, God bless you: Salman to Chiranjeevi
209.article_body: Actor Salman Khan took to Instagram and posted a video congratulating actor Chiranjeevi on the success of GodFather. "I heard that GodFather is doing really well. Congrats. God bless you," Salman could be heard saying in the video. As per the makers, 'GodFather' collected ₹38 crore worldwide on the first day. Salman has a cameo in the film.

210.title: Amit Shah, JP Nadda to embark on a 3-day visit to Assam from Oct 7
210.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah and BJP chief JP Nadda will embark on a three-day visit to Assam from October 7. The leaders will inaugurate the party's new state office in presence of CM Himanta Biswa Sarma, officials said. "After the function, the leaders will address a rally of BJP...workers at Veterinary College Playground in Khanapara," BJP state president said.

211.title: There should be no ban on anybody: Mammootty on Sreenath Bhasi
211.article_body: Speaking about Malayalam actor Sreenath Bhasi, actor Mammootty has said, "There should be no ban on anybody." This comes after Sreenath was arrested for abusing a woman anchor after which Kerala Film Producers' Association (KFPA) said that they won't cooperate with Sreenath. KFPA's statement was perceived as a ban, but they clarified they don't have the "power" to ban anyone.

212.title: Why is Delhi LG not ordering a probe into ₹6,000-cr MCD scam: AAP
212.article_body: The AAP on Thursday questioned Delhi LG VK Saxena why he hasn't ordered a probe into the alleged ₹6,000-crore scam in Delhi's municipal body. "It's been...two months since Deputy CM Manish Sisodia sent a letter to...LG, along with documents, asking for a probe into the scam," AAP's Durgesh Pathak said, questioning which BJP leader the LG was trying to protect.

213.title: Police AIG arrested in ₹1-crore bribe case in Punjab
213.article_body: The Vigilance Bureau, Punjab on Thursday arrested Assistant Inspector General of Police (AIG) Ashish Kapoor for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹1 crore. Kapoor is presently posted as Commandant, fourth India Reserve Battalion in Pathankot. Deputy Superintendent of Police Pawan Kumar and Assistant Sub-Inspector Harjinder Singh have also been named as accused in the case.

214.title: Shubman Gill creates history, becomes fastest Indian batter to reach 500 ODI runs
214.article_body: India opener Shubman Gill on Thursday created history by becoming the fastest Indian batter to reach 500 runs in ODIs. The 23-year-old reached the 500-run mark during his 7-ball 3-run knock against South Africa in the first ODI. He took 10 innings to reach the milestone. The previous record was held by Navjot Singh Sidhu, who took 11 innings.

215.title: Withdraw rule that makes 6 airbags mandatory in passenger cars: IRF to Gadkari
215.article_body: International Road Federation (IRF) has urged Road Transport Minister Nitin Gadkari to withdraw the notification making six airbags mandatory in passenger cars from October 2023. IRF said this rule should be made mandatory once 85% of the people start wearing rear seat belts. "Unless people start wearing rear seat belts, the provision of six airbags will become counterproductive," it said.

216.title: It is going to be better this time: Rashmika Mandanna on 'Pushpa 2'
216.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, speaking about 'Pushpa: The Rule', has said that the film will be "better and bigger". "It is going to start once 'Goodbye' releases, very soon. It is going to be better this time," she added. The film also features Allu Arjun and will be the sequel to the 2021 film 'Pushpa: The Rise'.

217.title: Hackers stole $399 million worth of crypto globally in Q3 2022: Report
217.article_body: A bug bounty platform Immunefi has found the world saw cryptocurrency losses of up to $428 million in Q3 2022. According to Immunefi, fraud accounts for only 7% of the total losses, while hacks account for 93% of the losses. Hackers reportedly stole $399 million worth of crypto. The two most targeted chains in Q3 were BNB Chain and Ethereum.

218.title: 2 men detained under Public Safety Act in J&K's Samba
218.article_body: Two alleged criminals, Vikas Slathia and Akshay Sharma, were detained under the Public Safety Act (PSA) in Jammu and Kashmir's Samba, the police said. The district magistrate formally issued their detention order under the PSA after dossiers of their repeated criminal activities were presented. The police added that many criminal cases were registered against them over the past decade.

219.title: Baghel inaugurates 'Chhattisgarhiya Olympics' to boost traditional sports
219.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel on Thursday inaugurated 'Chhattisgarhiya Olympics', which will have 14 types of traditional sports and will continue till January 6, an official said. The event is being held at Balbir Singh Juneja Indoor Stadium in Raipur. "The CM...tried his hand at a few traditional games...like 'langdi', 'bhaura', 'bati' and 'pitthul' to motivate participants," the official said.

220.title: Kuldeep Yadav recreates 'perfect' delivery from 2019 World Cup, ICC shares videos
220.article_body: India Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav recreated his 'perfect' delivery from 2019 World Cup to dismiss South Africa's Aiden Markram in first ODI in Lucknow. Kuldeep bowled Markram with a delivery that turned back into the batter significantly. Three years ago, he had dismissed Babar Azam in a similar fashion at World Cup and had termed his delivery as "perfect".

221.title: If Congress wanted 'Bharat Jodo', why didn't they abrogate Art 370: Munda
221.article_body: Union Tribal Affairs Minister Arjun Munda on Thursday claimed that the Congress wants to gain political mileage in the name of strengthening the nation. "The character of Congress has been well assessed by the people...If [Congress] really wanted 'Bharat Jodo'...why did not they abrogate Article 370 from Jammu and Kashmir?" he said. Congress launched 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' last month.

222.title: Fossil of cat-sized reptile, an early relative of flying reptile, found in Scotland
222.article_body: A fossil of a cat-sized reptile that was closely related to an extinct group of flying reptiles known as pterosaurs has been unearthed in Scotland. Named Scleromochlus taylori, the reptile lived on Earth about 240 to 210 million years ago. Scleromochlus had a large head, a long tail, a short neck, and a slender body, and stood on spindly legs.

223.title: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan launches anti-drug campaign
223.article_body: Kerala CM Pinarayi Vijayan has launched a month-long "no to drugs" awareness campaign and asked people from all walks of life to come together to remove all contraband from state. "We cannot waste even a second. We have to win this fight against drugs," Vijayan said. Special programmes will be held in schools and colleges as part of the campaign.

224.title: Toxic air pollution particles found in lungs, brains of unborn babies for the first time
224.article_body: Air pollution particles have been found in developing lungs and brains of unborn babies for the first time, a study by University of Aberdeen and Hasselt University in Belgium stated. Thousands of black carbon particles were found in each cubic millimetre of tissue, which were breathed in by mother during pregnancy and then passed through bloodstream and placenta to foetus.

225.title: 1.62 crore tourists visited J&K since January 2022, highest in 75 years: Govt
225.article_body: Around 1.62 crore tourists have visited Jammu and Kashmir since January 2022, the Union Territory government said on Thursday. The Directorate of Information and Public Relations (DIPR) of the J&K government said the tourist footfall in the Union Territory this year is the highest since India's independence, reported news agency ANI.

226.title: Waaree Energies raises ₹1,000 cr through investor funding
226.article_body: Solar panel manufacturing company Waaree Energies has raised ₹1,000 crore through investor funding. The firm withdrew its Draft Red Herring Prospectus (DRHP) filed with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) last year, owing to the funding round. The company was founded in 1989 by Hitesh Mehta and it recently reported a turnover of ₹2,000 crore.

227.title: Stay away from WhatsApp, it's been a spying tool for 13 yrs: Telegram Founder
227.article_body: Messaging service Telegram's Founder and CEO Pavel Durov in a note on Telegram said, "You can use any messaging app you like, but do stay away from WhatsApp – it has now been a surveillance tool for 13 years." He added, "Every year we learn about some issue in WhatsApp that puts everything on their users' devices at risk."

228.title: Partha Chatterjee's custody extended till Oct 19 in WB SSC scam case
228.article_body: A special CBI court has extended the judicial custody of ex-West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee till October 19 in connection with the School Service Commission recruitment scam case. The court has also sent three other ex-officials, including ex-WBBSE president Kalyanmoy Ganguly, to judicial custody till October 19. All four accused will be produced before the court again on October 19.

229.title: Give ₹3,000 to common people for Diwali: Congress to Maha govt
229.article_body: Congress state chief Nana Patole has asked Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde to deposit ₹3,000 in the bank accounts of common people of the state for Diwali. "The people suffering from inflation should get relief!" he tweeted. In a letter to Shinde, Patole said the state government's Diwali package of ₹100 for ration card holders is "too small" for a family.

230.title: Haryana sends cough syrup samples to lab after WHO alert on Gambia deaths
230.article_body: Haryana has sent samples of four cough syrups manufactured by Sonipat-based Maiden Pharmaceuticals Limited to a Kolkata lab for testing after WHO potentially linked them to the death of 66 children in Gambia. "Action...will be taken once the [lab] report comes," Haryana's Health Minister Anil Vij said. Notably, the concerned syrups aren't sold in India.

231.title: Never going to happen: Big B's granddaughter Navya on becoming actress
231.article_body: Amitabh Bachchan's granddaughter Navya Naveli Nanda, speaking about her plans to become an actress, said, "I think that dream is, unfortunately, going to be unfulfilled for many people." She said she keeps reminding people that she's an entrepreneur and that her becoming an actress is never going to happen. Navya's brother Agastya Nanda will make his debut in 'The Archies'.

232.title: 300 transgender artistes to be part of Sushmita's 'Taali': Report
232.article_body: Around 300 transgender artistes will reportedly be part of Sushmita Sen's upcoming web series 'Taali'. A source stated, "The show will require 25-50 trans artistes every day. A total of 300 transgender artistes have been hired for pivotal crowd scenes that will be shot over the next month." Sushmita will play transgender activist Gauri Sawant in the series.

233.title: 2 drug peddlers arrested, 156 gm heroin recovered in Meghalaya
233.article_body: The Meghalaya Police arrested two drug peddlers in East Khasi Hills district and over 156 grams of heroin was recovered from them, CM Conrad Sangma tweeted on Thursday. "Our war against drug trafficking is on!" he tweeted. The police also seized two smart phones, one vehicle and ₹1.28 lakh cash from the accused during the operation.

234.title: CM Eknath Shinde read BJP's script at Dussehra rally: Maha Cong chief
234.article_body: Maharashtra Congress chief Nana Patole took a jibe at Eknath Shinde, saying that the CM is "BJP's puppet" who read its script during the Dussehra rally at the Bandra Kurla Complex (BKC) ground on Wednesday. "We will not tolerate Shinde, his Ministers and MLAs repeatedly criticising the Congress to cover the sin of their rebellion," Patole said.

235.title: Porsche becomes Europe's most valuable automaker, valued at €85 bn
235.article_body: Porsche overtook parent company Volkswagen to become Europe's most valuable carmaker as its market valuation reached €85 billion. After falling below the listing price on Monday, Porsche's shares rose as investment banks bought 3.8 million shares for €312.8 million as part of the company's greenshoe option. Measures taken to stabilise Porsche's share price were seen as part of the IPO.

236.title: Zerodha's billionaire CEO shares his 5 healthy habits including 12 hrs of fasting
236.article_body: Zerodha's billionaire CEO Nithin Kamath shared five habits that made him healthier after a Twitter user asked for the same. "Dinner & killing all devices 2 hours before sleep. Yoga Nidra or some form of meditation for 10 minutes before sleep...12 hours of fasting at least," tweeted Kamath. "Setting daily activity goals on Apple Watch...Protein before a drink," he added.

237.title: Kuldeep Yadav sledges David Miller after he misses delivery, video goes viral
237.article_body: Team India Chinaman bowler Kuldeep Yadav sledged South Africa batter David Miller after the latter missed his delivery which turned sharply during the first ODI in Lucknow. Kuldeep was seen saying something to Miller following the delivery. The incident happened in the 24th over of South Africa's innings. Kuldeep registered figures of 8-0-39-1 in the match.

238.title: How to retweet it more than once: Shamsi on pic of ground dimensions used for 3rd T20I
238.article_body: South Africa spinner Tabraiz Shamsi retweeted a picture of ground dimensions used for third India-South Africa T20I in Indore. "Surely an international ground...should have bigger boundaries than 55 metres," the original tweet read. Shamsi wrote, "Does anyone know of a way which can allow me to retweet this more than once...Let's make cricket an even contest between bat and ball."

239.title: 2,500 positions in police department will be filled soon: Punjab CM
239.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Thursday said 2,500 positions in the police department will be filled soon. The new recruitments will include 1,156 constables (intelligence and investigation cadres), 787 head constables (investigation cadre) and 560 sub-inspectors (intelligence and investigation in district and armed police cadres). Mann said tests for the recruitments will be held later this month.

240.title: Will respond to Rahul Gandhi's letter on injured elephant: Bommai
240.article_body: Karnataka Chief Minister Basavaraj Bommai said that he will respond to Congress leader Rahul Gandhi's letter about an injured elephant calf at the Nagarahole Tiger Reserve, on humanitarian grounds. Rahul Gandhi wrote to Bommai, seeking intervention to provide timely treatment to the injured elephant calf. Bommai said he would speak to forest officials and ensure that treatment is given.

241.title: SEBI asks Brickwork Ratings to shut operations in 6 months
241.article_body: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) asked Brickwork Ratings to wind down operations within six months stating "failure to exercise proper skill, care and diligence, while discharging its duties as a credit rating agency". SEBI instructed the agency to not take on fresh clients or new mandates from now. Brickwork is one of seven SEBI-registered credit rating agencies.

242.title: 12 more bodies recovered from Uttarakhand's Draupadi ka Danda-2 peak
242.article_body: A total of 12 bodies of trainees were recovered from the Draupadi ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi on Thursday after an avalanche hit the mountain on Tuesday, said Nehru Institute of Mountaineering. With this, the total death toll of the incident has reached 16, including two instructors. Over 20 mountaineers are still believed to be missing.

243.title: For first 10 days in 'Chup', I kept thinking I'll get fired: Shreya
243.article_body: Actress Shreya Dhanwanthary revealed that she kept thinking that she will get fired from R Balki's 'Chup' for the first 10 days of the shoot. "I kept thinking that they will realise that they made a mistake, that I don't know anything and will let me go," she added. Shreya stated Balki had more faith in her than herself.

244.title: Vicky Kaushal's father posts 21-year-old photo of actor with Shah Rukh, pic goes viral
244.article_body: Actor Vicky Kaushal's father and action director Sham Kaushal has shared a 21-year-old photo of his sons, Vicky and Sunny, posing with Shah Rukh Khan on the sets of film 'Asoka'. Shershaah director Vishnu Vardhan, who worked as an assistant director in 'Asoka', is also seen in the photo. "Vicky was studying in 8th standard," Sham Kaushal wrote.

245.title: Raj woman strangles husband to death to get ₹50 lakh insurance, loan money
245.article_body: A 47-year-old woman in Rajasthan's Nagaur allegedly strangled her husband to death to claim an insurance amount and avail of a loan waiver of ₹50 lakh. The accused, Sharda, was reportedly also engaged in a property dispute with her husband over the last three years. Sharda and her husband engaged in an altercation on Tuesday, after which she strangled him.

246.title: 3 Hindu Munnani functionaries threaten beef stall worker in TN; arrested
246.article_body: Police have arrested three Hindu Munnani functionaries for threatening a beef stall employee in Tamil Nadu's Periyanaickenpalayam on Tuesday. The three functionaries, who were allegedly in an inebriated state, had threatened the employee against operating the stall. They were arrested based on a complaint by the stall's owner, who was not present at the stall when the incident happened.

247.title: Security arrangements made for Durga idol immersion in Hyderabad
247.article_body: Elaborate security arrangements have been made for immersion of Durga idols in Hyderabad, which will start on Thursday evening and continue till the early hours of Friday. Police expect around 6,000 idols to be immersed in the Hussain Sagar lake. Rapid Action Force (RAF) teams are deployed at MJ Market, Siddiamber Bazar, Charminar and Lal Darwaza to help local police.

248.title: Google Chrome is most vulnerable browser in 2022: Report
248.article_body: A new report by Atlas VPN has revealed that with 303 vulnerabilities in 2022, Google Chrome is the most vulnerable browser so far this year. It's also the all-time leader, with 3,159 cumulative vulnerabilities since its inception. It's followed by Mozilla Firefox, with 117 vulnerabilities, and Microsoft Edge, with 103 vulnerabilities. Apple's Safari browser documented 26 vulnerabilities in 2022.

249.title: ₹8.81 crore fine collected from traffic violators in Gurugram till August 2022
249.article_body: Gurugram Traffic Police said they have collected ₹8.81 crore as fines from around 8 lakh traffic violators between January and August this year. As per police, most of these challans have been issued for driving in the wrong direction, followed by for driving without high-security number plates, no entry, excess seating capacity, dangerous driving, using black films etc.

250.title: Women engage in fight, pull each other's hair in Thane local; video surfaces
250.article_body: An argument between two women on board Thane-Panvel local train turned violent after they started thrashing each other. A video of the incident that reportedly took place on Wednesday evening has surfaced on social media. The women are seen pulling each other's hair and raining slaps on each other in the video.

251.title: Any role that anybody gets is because Leo DiCaprio passed on it: Bale
251.article_body: Actor Christian Bale has said that any role that anybody gets is because Leonardo DiCaprio passed on it. "All those people that I've worked with multiple times, they all offered every one of those roles to him first," he added. Bale further stated, "So, thank you, Leo, because literally, he gets to choose everything he does."

252.title: 17-yr-old boy stabbed with a knife in Delhi after fight on Dussehra
252.article_body: A 17-year-old boy was stabbed to death after a fight with a group in Delhi's Jahangirpuri on Wednesday during Dussehra celebrations. The deceased had gone to watch Ramlila when he got into a fight with a group of people. He collapsed in a pool of blood with the knife still stuck in his chest while the attackers escaped.

253.title: People visit Ujjain flyover for selfies before 'Mahakal Lok' opening
253.article_body: Ahead of the 'Mahakal Lok' opening, Ujjain's Hari Phatak Overbridge has turned into a 'selfie point' as everyday people can be seen gathering near the parapet and taking photos. "People of Ujjain are super excited about the new corridor," a resident of the city said. Prime Minister Narendra Modi will inaugurate the new corridor on October 11.

254.title: India urges New Zealand to be 'fairer' over student visa issue
254.article_body: External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar interacted with his New Zealand counterpart Nanaia Mahuta on Thursday and raised the issue of visa delays being faced by Indian students. Some students had to leave New Zealand due to COVID-19 and couldn't get the opportunity to get their visas renewed. Jaishankar said he urged a fairer and more sympathetic treatment for these students.

255.title: Man stabbed to death at Hyderabad's Edi Bazaar
255.article_body: A man was stabbed to death by a group of people in Hyderabad's old city area on Tuesday. The victim, identified as Syed Baqtiyar Agha Qureshi, had come to meet some people near Anmol Hotel at Edi Bazaar where he was attacked with sharp-edged weapons and died on the spot. The police shifted the body to the Osmania Hospital mortuary.

256.title: Hawkers assault 52-yr-old woman on bridge of Thane railway station
256.article_body: A 52-year-old woman was assaulted on the bridge of Thane railway station after she had an altercation with some hawkers whose merchandise was displayed in a manner that was impeding the movement of people. "A group of hawkers hit her and also outraged her modesty," a railway police official said. The accused have been booked, he added.

257.title: Scores of flights cancelled in Germany as Eurowings' pilots go on strike
257.article_body: Scores of flights were cancelled in Germany on Thursday as pilots of domestic carrier Eurowings went on a strike. The pilots have demanded better pay and more rest hours between flights. By Thursday morning, more than 150 flights were cancelled across German cities. Around 30,000 passengers are expected to be affected by the strike.

258.title: Expression of interest invited for Future Retail's insolvency resolution process
258.article_body: The resolution professional of Future Retail (FRL) has invited 'expression of interest' from prospective buyers under the ongoing Corporate Insolvency Resolution Process. All interested and eligible prospective applicants (PRA) for FRL will have to submit an expression of interest for the resolution plan by October 20. The resolution professional will issue the final list of PRAs on November 6.

259.title: Rupee drops 32 paise to close at all-time low of 81.94 against US dollar
259.article_body: The Indian rupee declined by 32 paise to close at a record low of 81.94 against the US dollar on Thursday. At the interbank foreign exchange market, the local currency opened at 81.52 and witnessed an intra-day high of 81.51 against the American currency. Earlier, on Tuesday, the rupee appreciated by 20 paise to end at 81.62 against the dollar.

260.title: Acid-like chemical sprayed at girl in MP's Durga puja pandal; 10 arrested
260.article_body: A group of men reportedly sprayed an acid-like or inflammable chemical on a girl at a Durga puja pandal in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur on Tuesday. Police have arrested 10 persons in the case. While they are trying to ascertain the motive behind the attack, it's not clear if the girl was the actual target or not. She has been hospitalised.

261.title: China to increase coercion after Prez Xi assumes 3rd term: Taiwan
261.article_body: Taiwan's Minister of Mainland Affairs Council Chiu Tai-san on Thursday said Beijing will increase its coercion and intimidation tactics against the island after Chinese President Xi Jinping assumes a third term in office. China considers Taiwan as its own territory. Chiu said Beijing's work in relation to Taiwan has entered a phase of so-called 'anti-independence and promoting reunification'.

262.title: Ex-DC spinner Lamichhane arrested on landing in Nepal in 17-yr-old girl's rape case
262.article_body: Former Nepal captain and former Delhi Capitals spinner Sandeep Lamichhane was arrested immediately upon landing in Nepal's Kathmandu on Thursday in 17-year-old girl's rape case. In a video shared by Kantipur TV on Twitter, the 22-year-old can be seen being escorted in police custody. The 17-year-old girl had accused Lamichhane of raping her at a hotel in Kathmandu.

263.title: My role was mine: Mouni on if her role was better than Alia's in Brahmastra
263.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy was asked about her role being better than Alia Bhatt's in 'Brahmastra'. To this, she replied, "Why are you asking me such controversial questions? My role was mine. My responsibility was to play the antagonist...that's what I focussed on and that's what I did." Mouni played Junoon in the film, which also featured Ranbir Kapoor.

264.title: Very happy to have support of young people in the party: Shashi Tharoor
264.article_body: Talking about the party's Presidential Poll, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor said he feels very happy to have the support of young people in the party. "I'm not turning away any support, be it young or old," he said. "We need everyone to join us in this adventure of making a rejuvenated Congress to lead young India," he added.

265.title: Pathankot residents paste posters of 'missing' MP Sunny Deol on houses, cars
265.article_body: Several posters of BJP's Gurdaspur MP Sunny Deol were pasted by people on walls of houses, vehicles and railway stations in Punjab's Pathankot which read "gumshuda ki talaash" (searching for a missing person). "After becoming [the] MP, [Deol hasn't] visited Gurdaspur. He...hasn't brought any industrial development [here]...If he doesn't want to work, he should [resign]," a protesting local said.

266.title: Investors get ₹7.6 lakh cr richer in 2 trading sessions as Sensex rallies
266.article_body: Investors' wealth rose by ₹7.6 lakh crore in two trading sessions as market capitalisation of BSE-listed firms rose to ₹275.9 lakh crore on Thursday. BSE Sensex, which rose over 1,400 points in the last two trading sessions, closed 156.63 points higher at 58,222.10 on Thursday. ICICI Bank, Infosys, ITC and Reliance were among the top contributors to Sensex's rise.

267.title: DCW seeks action-taken report over 11-yr-old's rape inside Delhi school
267.article_body: Delhi Commission for Women (DCW) on Thursday sought an action-taken report from Delhi Police on alleged rape of an 11-year-old girl by two senior students inside a Delhi school's washroom in July. She had allegedly reported the matter to a teacher but school authorities didn't refer it to Delhi Police. DCW has sought details of arrests made by October 10.

268.title: Deepak Nirula of ice cream and fast food chain Nirula's passes away at 70
268.article_body: Deepak Nirula, the son of Madan Gopal Nirula, who made the fast food brand 'Nirula's' famous across north India, passed away at 70 on Tuesday. The family sold the brand name to Navis Capital Partners in 2006. "Thank you for giving us our first pizza, our first burger, our first ice-cream parlour experience," an Instagram post by Nirula's said.

269.title: Microsoft may invest $100 mn in Indian gaming firm Zupee: Report
269.article_body: Microsoft is in talks to invest over $100 million in Indian online gaming platform, Zupee, as per a report. The report added that the deal may not go through as Microsoft thinks that Zupee's pay-to-win service may be seen as gambling. If the deal goes through, Zupee will reportedly use Azure and other Microsoft cloud services.

270.title: My wife doesn't write as many love letters to me as you do: Kejriwal to Delhi L-G
270.article_body: Taking a jibe at Delhi Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena, Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Thursday said that even his wife doesn't write as many love letters to him as he does. "My wife doesn't scold me as much as L-G sahib does every day," Kejriwal tweeted in Hindi. L-G sahib, chill a little, he further said.

271.title: 45-year-old female journalist dies in road mishap in Bengaluru
271.article_body: A 45-year-old female journalist died and her husband was injured after their scooter was hit by a truck on Bengaluru's Hebbal Flyover on Tuesday. The deceased journalist was identified as CR Latha, who worked for a Kannada news TV channel. The truck is reported to have grazed the scooter, following which Lata fell under the truck.

272.title: US-led military exercises provoked North Korea: Russia, China at the UN
272.article_body: Russia and China on Wednesday told the United Nations (UN) that military exercises led by the US had provoked North Korea into test firing missiles. The United Nations Security Council was debating on how to respond to North Korea which launched a ballistic missile over Japanese territory. The session ended without an agreement on what the next steps should be.

273.title: HC orders probe in linkage of sewage & stormwater drains in B'luru
273.article_body: The Karnataka High Court (HC) has ordered a probe to ascertain which agency allowed connecting an underground drainage system from a residential layout to a stormwater drain in Bengaluru Urban district. The investigation will be led by an officer of the rank of a Deputy Commissioner of Police or above. The court said adverse effects of this connection include waterlogging.

274.title: World Bank cuts India's growth forecast to 6.5% for 2022-23
274.article_body: The World Bank, in its twice-a-year report on South Asia, cut its growth forecast for India to 6.5% year-on-year for 2022-23, from earlier estimates of 7.5%. It further warned that the Russia-Ukraine war and global monetary tightening will affect the economy. "Private investment growth is likely to be dampened by heightened uncertainty and higher financing costs," the World Bank said.

275.title: Rain disrupts electricity supply in parts of Hyderabad
275.article_body: After heavy rains lashed Hyderabad on Thursday, electricity supply in various parts of the city was impacted. Telangana State Southern Power Distribution Company Limited took to Twitter to announce that power supply will be restored soon. Sriram Nagar, Srinagar Colony and Indira Nagar faced power cuts for nearly an hour. A yellow alert was issued by the IMD for Hyderabad.

276.title: Man arrested for smuggling ₹27-crore gold watch studded with diamonds at Delhi airport
276.article_body: The Delhi Customs have arrested an Indian national at IGI airport on his arrival from Dubai for allegedly smuggling seven luxury wrist watches, including one Jacob & Co watch made of gold and studded with diamonds worth ₹27 crore. Besides the watches, a diamond-studded gold bracelet and an iPhone 14 Pro 256 GB was also recovered from the passenger.

277.title: Crowd at Maha CM's rally showed which is real Shiv Sena: Fadnavis
277.article_body: Maharashtra Deputy CM Devendra Fadnavis said that the "huge" crowd at CM Eknath Shinde's Dussehra rally in Mumbai showed who leads the real Shiv Sena. "There was a huge gathering at the BKC ground whose capacity is the double of that of Shivaji Park (where Uddhav Thackeray spoke), and the BKC ground was filled to the brim," Fadnavis said.

278.title: Cong's 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' will have no impact: K'taka CM Bommai
278.article_body: The Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which is currently passing through Karnataka, "will have no impact", CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Thursday. "Naturally all party leaders will work for their own party, she (Sonia Gandhi)...walked for half-a-kilometer and gone, it's okay," Bommai said. He rejected claims that BJP was planning state-wide tours of its leaders to counter the Congress' yatra.

279.title: BJP MP Pragya Thakur appears before court in Malegaon blast case
279.article_body: BJP MP Pragya Singh Thakur, a prime accused in the 2008 Malegaon blast case, appeared before a Mumbai trial court on Thursday. Her lawyer cross-examined an official of the Maharashtra Anti-Terrorism Squad who had arrested her. Thakur, who initially sat on the wooden bench assigned for the accused, was allowed to sit on a chair after she complained of backache.

280.title: 19-yr-old held for stabbing sanitation employee to death in Thane
280.article_body: A 19-year-old man, Monish Dilip Jadhav, was arrested for stabbing a 40-year-old sanitation employee of Bhiwandi Nizampur City Municipal Corporation (BNCMC) to death at her house in Thane, police said. The accused was the neighbour of the deceased Savita Shivram Salve and was robbing her house when he was caught red-handed. Jadhav then stabbed her and escaped from the house.

281.title: Work on flyover at Pune University junction may start next week
281.article_body: The Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) has planned to start the work on the multi-level flyover at the Pune University junction next week. Earlier, the PMRDA had declared that the work on the flyover will start in September and later said that it would start on Friday. However, it again postponed it on PMC's request due to traffic issues.

282.title: Ranbir wants me to get back to work soon after baby's birth: Alia Bhatt
282.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has revealed that her husband and actor Ranbir Kapoor wants her to go back to work soon after their baby's birth. "He...said in an interview...'I have this very big responsibility...to send Alia back to work because the fans would really complain...hold me responsible if I don't do my bit as a parent as well'," she stated.

283.title: My 1st pay cheque was ₹7,000 when I had no bank account: Sidharth Malhotra
283.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra revealed his first pay cheque was for ₹7,000 and added that he had no bank account when he received the cheque. Speaking about his acting aspirations as a child, Sidharth said that his family never took him seriously. "It was...in my late teens I started facing still cameras and all and then that whole thing," he added.

284.title: India, Indonesia debt outperforms China despite global selloff
284.article_body: According to reports, the sovereign debt of India and Indonesia lost 0.4% and 1.5% respectively for dollar-based investors in the third quarter, less than other emerging Asian markets including China. The Rupiah and the Rupee have the widest spreads in emerging Asia, offering investors relief from global market volatility. China hasn’t seen the scale of foreign inflows observed last year.

285.title: Ex-UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav on 'life-saving' drugs: Medanta Hospital
285.article_body: Gurugram's Medanta Hospital on Thursday claimed that former UP CM and Samajwadi Party leader Mulayam Singh Yadav is on "life-saving" drugs. "He is being treated in the ICU by a comprehensive team of specialists," the hospital said. Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday reached the hospital to enquire about Yadav's health.

286.title: India will do whatever it can for Ukraine crisis' solution: EAM
286.article_body: External Affairs Minister (EAM) S Jaishankar on Thursday said that India is willing to do whatever it can to facilitate a solution to the Ukraine crisis. He said it is natural that different countries and different regions would react a little differently when it comes to Ukraine. Jaishankar said this during his interaction with Auckland Business Chamber's CEO Simon Bridges.

287.title: SEBI may start criminal prosecution of market offenders: Report
287.article_body: The central government in consultation with the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) is looking to allow the market regulator to initiate criminal prosecution of market offenders, according to a report. Presently, SEBI can not prosecute offenders and can only initiate proceedings against them in any court of the country. It can, however, pass penalty orders against these offenders.

288.title: Not selling anything in India: Indian firm behind syrups linked to 66 deaths in Gambia
288.article_body: Indian cough syrup manufacturer Maiden Pharmaceuticals is "not selling anything in India", the company's director Naresh Kumar Goyal told Reuters. He added that the company is trying to find out from its buyer in Gambia details related to the deaths of 66 children which the WHO said may have been linked to its products.

289.title: 26-yr-old man arrested with 'Meow Meow' drug worth ₹1 lakh in Pune
289.article_body: Pune Police's Anti-Narcotic Cell arrested a 26-year-old man with 6.9 grams of mephedrone or 'Meow Meow' drug worth ₹1 lakh. "We're looking at...supply chain and distribution network of the suspect," a police officer said. "Primary probe suggests...he used to buy the contraband from a dealer in Mumbai and had been selling it in Pune in small packets," he added.

290.title: Alia Bhatt shares pictures with Ranbir Kapoor from her baby shower
290.article_body: Alia Bhatt took to Instagram to share pictures with actor-husband Ranbir Kapoor from her baby shower. "Just...love," she wrote in the caption of the post. Two of the pictures show the Bhatt and the Kapoor families while another picture shows Alia with some of her friends, including Akansha Ranjan Kapoor. The baby shower was held at Alia and Ranbir's home.

291.title: He should apologise to nation: Anil Vij over Udit Raj's remark on Prez
291.article_body: Reacting to Congress leader Udit Raj's "chamchagiri" remark on President Droupadi Murmu, Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij said that Raj should apologise to the nation for his statement. "Udit Raj's statement is shameful. Droupadi Murmu has become President after winning the election," Vij said. "He is insulting the democratic system, he is insulting a tribal woman," he added.

292.title: CCI must fairly address global mergers and acquisition issues: FM Sitharaman
292.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said the Competition Commission of India must "fairly and squarely" address issues arising out of cross-country mergers and acquisitions. She added that CCI should pay attention to Indian law and its evolution keeping fair trade and competition in mind. "It should also be cognisant of what is developing in different parts of the world," she said.

293.title: Walked half-a-km and gone: K’taka CM on Sonia Gandhi joining Bharat Jodo Yatra
293.article_body: After Congress chief Sonia Gandhi joined party's Bharat Jodo Yatra on Thursday in Karnataka, CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "She has walked for half-a-km and gone." Speaking about the yatra, he said, "Naturally, all party leaders will work for their own party...As far as we're concerned, we have nothing to do with it and it doesn't make any impact."

294.title: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel gets environmental clearance for Hazira plant expansion
294.article_body: ArcelorMittal Nippon Steel India announced it has received environment clearance for expansion of its plant in Hazira to 15 million tonnes per annum (MTPA) from the current crude steel capacity of 9 MTPA. The company said government's National Steel Policy would receive a big boost from the project. The venture will also help the company's own long-term capacity expansion ambitions.

295.title: SEBI nod for IPOs worth ₹5,000 crore to expire this month
295.article_body: Approvals given by SEBI for IPOs worth ₹5,000 crore are set to lapse in October as four firms have delayed the issue launch amid tough market conditions.  The companies are One Mobikwik Systems, Skanray Technologies, Penna Cement Industries, and ESAF Small Finance Bank. According to experts, Paytm owner One97 Communications' disappointing listing was another reason for the delay.

296.title: 3 killed as car skids off, falls 50 feet down in Uttarakhand’s Bageshwar
296.article_body: A car skidded off a road and fell 50 feet down in Uttarakhand's Bageshwar on Thursday, leading to the death of three people. Police said one person, who was injured in the accident, has been admitted to the hospital. The four people were on their way back home after a Ramleela show when the driver lost control over the car.

297.title: 'Citadel' India set in 90s, series to go on floors by Nov end: Report
297.article_body: The Indian version of 'Citadel', starring Varun Dhawan and Samantha Ruth Prabhu, is reportedly set in the 1990s and will go on floors by the end of November or early December. Varun and Samantha will reportedly start their workshops for the Raj and DK directorial series by early November. It's expected to premiere by the second half of 2023.

298.title: 3 SP leaders write to Akhilesh, seek to donate kidney to Mulayam Singh
298.article_body: Three Samajwadi Party (SP) Councillors from Bareilly have written a letter to party chief Akhilesh Yadav expressing their will to donate a kidney to Mulayam Singh Yadav. The 82-year-old MP is in the ICU of Gurugram's Medanta hospital. Gaurav Saxena, Shamim Ahmed and Raees Mian Abbasi said donating a kidney to him would be a matter of pride for them.

299.title: Vintage cars on display to promote wildlife protection in B'luru
299.article_body: To create awareness about wildlife week, the Karnataka Forest Department called vintage car and motorcycle owners to promote the idea of preserving things from the past in Bengaluru. The vehicle owners held a rally at the Vidhana Soudha. Wildlife week is observed from October 2 to October 8 to create awareness among people about the importance of wildlife protection.

300.title: Mountaineering, trekking banned in Uttarkashi till Oct 8 over bad weather alert
300.article_body: Uttarkashi District Magistrate Abhishek Ruhela has said that trekking and mountaineering activities have been banned in Uttarkashi district from October 6-8. His decision came after the meteorological department issued an alert for rain and snowfall in the region. Recently, 10 trainee mountaineers were killed in an avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarkashi.

301.title: Scooby-Doo's Velma is a lesbian, confirms new Halloween movie
301.article_body: Scooby-Doo's Velma Dinkley has been confirmed as a lesbian in 'Trick or Treat Scooby-Doo!'. It shows Velma's character having a crush on Coco Diablo, a new character who plays the head of a costume crime syndicate. To mark the moment, Google has added a feature in which pride flags and confetti appear if one searches for any Velma-related term.

302.title: New Vande Bharat Express hits herd of buffaloes, front part of engine damaged; pic surfaces
302.article_body: The recently inaugurated Vande Bharat Express running between Mumbai Central and Gandhinagar met with an accident on Thursday, after a herd of buffloes came on the tracks. The incident occurred between Vatva station to Maninagar in Gujarat. The accident damaged the front part of the engine, said Western Railway Senior PRO JK Jayant.

303.title: There was no Hindu religion during Rajaraja Cholan's period: Kamal Haasan
303.article_body: Speaking about 'Ponniyin Selvan: I', Kamal Haasan has said that there was no such thing as "Hindu religion" during the reign of Rajaraja Cholan. "There was Vainavam, Shivam and Samanam...the Britishers gave us that name (Hindu) as they didn't know how to refer to us collectively," he added. Recently, filmmaker Vetrimaaran objected to portraying Rajaraja Cholan as a Hindu king.

304.title: Shami is somebody the opposition do fear: Steyn on Bumrah's replacement
304.article_body: Ex-South Africa pacer Dale Steyn has said he has written down Mohammad Shami's name as Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "As [Bumrah's] replacement, I'd look at someone who can qualify with similar experience. Shami is probably the guy I would go with," stated Steyn. "Shami's somebody the opposition do fear," he added.

305.title: BJP's fall in next poll begins: Jairam during Bharat Jodo Yatra in K'taka
305.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh on Thursday, during the Congress' ongoing Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka, said, "The response we have garnered from a BJP-ruled state in Karnataka shows that the countdown for BJP's fall in the next election has begun." Congress chief Sonia Gandhi also joined the yatra today in Karnataka. The Karnataka leg of the march began on Friday.

306.title: BEST to begin premium bus service by mid-October in Mumbai
306.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) is set to launch a premium bus service by mid-October to reduce the number of cars on city roads. "The premium bus service will run with 100 buses in the fleet till December," Lokesh Chandra, General Manager of BEST, said. Users will be able to book their tickets through Chalo app, he added.

307.title: Nobel Prize in Literature awarded to French author Annie Ernaux
307.article_body: The 2022 Nobel Prize in Literature has been awarded to French author Annie Ernaux. She has been given the award "for the courage and clinical acuity with which she uncovers the roots, estrangements and collective restraints of personal memory", a tweet read. Her writing "examines a life marked by strong disparities regarding gender, language and class", said Nobel Prize's website.

308.title: 3 kids die, 11 hospitalised after eating at children's home in Tamil Nadu
308.article_body: At least three children died and 11 others were hospitalised due to suspected food poisoning after they consumed food at a children's home in Tamil Nadu's Tiruppur. Following dinner on Wednesday, some children vomited while others had dysentery. Their condition deteriorated after they had breakfast on Thursday. The deceased, who died without responding to treatment, were aged between 10-13 years.

309.title: I almost joined McKinsey before starting Bhanzu: World's fastest human calculator
309.article_body: Neelakantha Bhanu Prakash, the 22-year-old known as the world's fastest human calculator, almost joined McKinsey before starting his math learning startup Bhanzu. "I started out at IIIT Hyderabad...dropped out...went to Delhi's St Stephen's College and started teaching and doing stage shows at the age of 17," he said. Founded in 2020, Bhanzu investors include CRED's Kunal Shah and comedian Biswa.

310.title: Lloyd's of London detects 'unusual activity', probes possible cyberattack
310.article_body: Insurance company Lloyd's of London has said it is investigating a possible cyberattack after the firm detected "an unusual activity on its network". "As a precautionary measure, we are resetting the Lloyd's network and systems. All external connectivity has been turned off, including Lloyd's delegated authority platforms," a spokesperson said. Around 100 insurance syndicates operate at Lloyd's.

311.title: Pay ₹10 lakh to kins of men who died inside sewer: Delhi HC to DDA
311.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed Delhi Development Authority (DDA) to pay ₹10 lakh each to the families of two men who died after inhaling toxic gases inside a sewer in Mundka area last month. "It is very unfortunate that even after 75 years of independence, poor people are being forced to work as manual scavengers," the High Court observed.

312.title: RTI activist injured, son killed by man accused of illegal mining in Guj
312.article_body: A man, accused of illegal mining, allegedly rammed his car into the scooter of a Dalit RTI activist who was with his 23-year-old son in Gujarat's Kutch on Monday, police said. The activist was seriously injured and his son succumbed to his injuries, police added. The activist had filed complaints of illegal mining against the man around a year ago.

313.title: 1,300 kg marijuana seized from 2 drug peddlers in Hyderabad, held
313.article_body: Hyderabad's Rachakonda Police arrested two interstate drug peddlers and seized 1,300 kg marijuana from them. Along with the contraband, the police also seized a vehicle and two mobile phones, all worth ₹2.80 crore, they stated in a press release. The accused regularly transported marijuana from Andhra Pradesh's East Godavari district to Telangana, Madhya Pradesh and other states, police stated.

314.title: Pak don't have a no. 4, fans leave stadium once openers get out: Ex-player Aaqib
314.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed has said their current side doesn't have a batter like Virat Kohli in their middle order and that's why they should experiment by bringing captain Babar Azam at number four position. "They don't have any player for number four...You are completely dependent on the openers. If they get dismissed, fans leave the stadium," added Aaqib.

315.title: Samsung's Q3 profit may fall by 25%, the first in 3 years: Report
315.article_body: Samsung Electronics' third-quarter profit could reportedly decline by 25%, the first year-on-year fall in nearly three years, according to a Refinitiv SmartEstimate. This could be driven by a fall in demand for electronic devices and the chips that power them due to rising inflation. Samsung's operating profit has likely fallen to 11.8 trillion won ($8.3 billion) in the July-September quarter,

316.title: Agritech startup FALCA raises $3 mn in Pre-Series A funding round
316.article_body: Agritech startup FALCA has secured more than $3 million in a Pre-Series A funding round led by Inflection Point Ventures. The funding round also saw participation of LetsVenture, Mumbai Angels, along with other high-net-worth individuals. The startup was founded in 2018 by Santosh Danegoudar. The company said that it is currently working with 1,00,000 farmers.

317.title: Suspected of being child lifters, 3 ‘sadhus’ beaten in Chhattisgarh
317.article_body: A mob beat up three men dressed like 'sadhus' in Chhattisgarh's Durg district on Wednesday, said police. The people suspected them to be child thieves after they were seen speaking to some children at a Dussehra fair, said police. The victims, who hailed from Rajasthan, sustained minor injuries and were treated at a local hospital.

318.title: Driver was distracted as he was plugging charger: Police on Mumbai accident that killed 5
318.article_body: The accused in Mumbai's Bandra-Worli Sea Link accident, identified as Irfan Abdul Raheem Beelkia, has been arrested by the police. The interrogation of the accused revealed he was trying to plug in his mobile phone charger and lost sight of the road ahead, police said. A total of five persons were killed and eight others were injured in the accident.

319.title: Pics of liquor bottles surface after CM Shinde’s Dussehra rally in Mumbai
319.article_body: Yuva Sena, the youth wing of Uddhav Thackeray-led Shiv Sena, shared pictures of liquor bottles and garbage, a day after Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde's Dussehra rally. The pictures are of Mumbai University's Kalina campus, which provided the parking facility for the event. Yuva Sena workers shared images of liquor bottles, thrown-away food and have demanded action against the organisers.

320.title: Local trains hit due to snag at Mumbai's Sandhurst Road station
320.article_body: Suburban train services were disrupted on Thursday due to a technical snag in overhead wires at south Mumbai's Sandhurst Road station. The snag, which occurred at about 1:00 pm, resulted in trains heading towards Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj Terminus being held up. Affected services have been diverted to the fast line and restoration work is in full swing, Central Railway said.

321.title: Electronics Mart India's IPO subscribed 6 times on day 2
321.article_body: Electronics Mart India's initial public offering (IPO) was subscribed six times on Thursday, the second day of bidding, as the participants bought 37.42 crore equity shares against the offer size of 6.25 crore shares. Retail investors subscribed 6.98 times, while non-institutional investors bought 8.08 times the portion. Qualified institutional buyers subscribed 2.67 times the reserved portion.

322.title: Shameful: NCW chief on Cong leader's 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez
322.article_body: National Commission for Women (NCW) Chairperson Rekha Sharma has criticised Congress leader Udit Raj after he said, "No country should get President like Droupadi Murmu. Chamchagiri also has its limits." "[Raj's] statement is not just against a woman but a constitutional head of government," the NCW chief said. "Comments made are condemnable. The derogatory language used is shameful," she added.

323.title: Solomon Islands won't be used by foreign military: Sogavare to Aus PM
323.article_body: Solomon Islands PM Manasseh Sogavare met his Australian counterpart Anthony Albanese in Canberra. "Solomon Islands will not do anything that will undermine our national security...will never be used for foreign military installations," Sogavare reportedly said. A joint statement issued by Albanese's office said the two leaders discussed bilateral ties, climate change and aspirations for Pacific.

324.title: SpiceJet shares jump 9% after report of ₹1,000 crore government loan
324.article_body: Shares of SpiceJet jumped by 9% on Thursday following reports of the airline likely receiving an additional loan of ₹1,000 crore under the government's modified Emergency Credit Line Guarantee Scheme. According to reports, the funds will help the airline clear its dues and induct new Boeing 737 Max planes. SpiceJet is currently operating less than 50% of its approved flights.

325.title: 19-year-old traces bike, catches thieves in 90 minutes in Navi Mumbai
325.article_body: A 19-year-old boy, along with his cousin, traced his stolen bike and caught the thieves within 90 minutes in Navi Mumbai. After the boy found his bike missing, he rushed to nearby petrol pump, assuming the thieves must have gone there as the bike didn't have enough petrol. When they reached there, they saw the thieves leaving and caught them.

326.title: I would love to see Umran Malik unleashed in Australia: Brett Lee
326.article_body: Ex-Australia pacer Brett Lee has said India's 22-year-old pacer Umran Malik and Australia's 23-year-old all-rounder Cameron Green should've been part of their respective teams for the upcoming 2022 T20 WC. "I'd love to see Umran unleashed in Australia...[and] I can't fathom how Cameron isn't in [Australia's] team," he stated. Umran picked 22 wickets in his 14 games in IPL 2022.

327.title: Akasa Air to allow pets on board, bookings to begin from Oct 15
327.article_body: Newly launched airline Akasa Air said passengers can carry pets on board from November, the bookings for which will begin from October 15. One pet per person with weight of up to 7 kgs will be allowed, and domesticated cats and dogs have to be in a cage to board the flight. The pricing for this has not been disclosed.

328.title: Struggled between life, death for 3hrs: U'khand avalanche survivor
328.article_body: Deep Thakur, an Uttarakhand avalanche survivor recounted the experience after being rescued from Draupadi's Danda Peak in Uttarkashi. Thakur said the avalanche came suddenly, following which he and his companions fell into the crevasses about 60 feet deep and struggled between death and life for about three hours. Deep was among the 41 mountaineers who were stuck in the avalanche.

329.title: Gold prices in India surge to highest level in nearly 2 months
329.article_body: Gold rates on Thursday were the highest since August 16 as the Indian benchmark indices rose amid subdued dollar and Treasury yields. On the Multi Commodity Exchange, gold prices were up by 0.51%, touching ₹51,910 per 10 grams around 10:20 am. Gold prices also rose globally. Spot gold was up 0.4% at $1,722.09 per ounce in the initial trade.

330.title: Seen very few marriages work, would like to disprove that: Ali Fazal
330.article_body: Actor Ali Fazal said he's seen "very few marriages work" in his life, which is something he'd like to "disprove" in his relationship with Richa Chadha. The actor, who recently got married to Richa, said he shares "something spiritual" with the actress. "I thank her for that because she's made me more spiritually aware than I was before," he said.

331.title: Pune Zilla Parishad sets up 'inspection unit' to monitor public works
331.article_body: Pune Zilla Parishad has set up a Development and Scheme Inspection Unit to monitor the implementation of public works and welfare schemes. "The unit will have six staffers...With the help of Pune ZP's software system that allows contractors to fill up daily updates on work progress, it will monitor the progress of all public works," an official said.

332.title: 12,000 Meta employees may lose jobs amid 'quiet layoffs': Report
332.article_body: Meta, formerly Facebook, is undergoing "quiet layoffs" that could affect 15% or around 12,000 employees of the company's workforce, Insider reported citing several employees. Meta's executives reportedly told directors across the company to select at least 15% of their team to be labelled as "needs support". These employees will be put on a performance improvement plan and eventually let go.

333.title: Mumbai man sentenced to 10-year jail for raping minor daughter for 7 years
333.article_body: A man in Mumbai was sentenced to ten years in jail for raping his minor daughter for seven years. The accused worked on a ship in Saudi Arabia and visited his family every two months. In 2014, his wife noticed that their daughter avoided him and the girl told her that she was sexually assaulted by her father many times.

334.title: Mumbai's Charni Road's old foot-over bridge to be shut for 45 days
334.article_body: The old foot-over bridge (FOB) of Charni Road station of Mumbai Suburban Railway will be closed for 45 days till November 18 owing to construction work, according to Western Railway. The FOB will be closed for constructing a link connecting the newly constructed foot over-bridge and platforms 2 and 3. Both spans of the existing FOB will be dismantled.

335.title: India announce their playing XI for 1st ODI against South Africa
335.article_body: India captain Shikhar Dhawan won the toss and elected to bowl first in the first ODI against South Africa. The match has been reduced to 40 overs per side contest due to rain delay. Batter Ruturaj Gaikwad and leg-spinner Ravi Bishnoi are making their ODI debut for India. India's playing XI also includes Sanju Samson, Ishan Kishan and Kuldeep Yadav.

336.title: Mumbai reports more than 100 COVID-19 cases for 2nd straight day
336.article_body: According to Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation, Mumbai reported 127 new COVID-19 cases on Wednesday, taking the overall tally to 11,50,828. This comes a day after the city recorded 155 COVID-19 cases. No fresh death due to the infection was recorded on Wednesday, while 116 patients recovered in the last 24 hours. The number of active COVID-19 cases in Mumbai is 795.

337.title: Twitter to now let users post tweets with different media formats
337.article_body: Twitter is rolling out a new feature that lets users combine three media formats (GIFs, photos, videos) in a single tweet on both Android and iOS devices. "This feature will roll out globally...with a chance to see mixed media Tweets on the web," Twitter said. Users can also rearrange their media's layout while composing a tweet, it added.

338.title: Roblox enabled a girl's sexual and financial exploitation: Lawsuit
338.article_body: A lawsuit has accused Roblox of enabling a girl's sexual and financial exploitation by adult men in US' California. The lawsuit claims that the victim came in contact with adult men through Roblox, who encouraged her to use Discord, Snapchat and Instagram. They then exploited her by encouraging her to abuse prescription drugs and send sexually explicit photos of herself.

339.title: 16-kg heroin worth ₹80 crore seized at Mumbai airport, flyer arrested
339.article_body: The Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) arrested an airline passenger with drugs at Mumbai airport following a tip-off on Wednesday. The DRI seized 16 kg of heroin valued at more than ₹80 crore from his luggage. The accused, who is a resident of Kerala, revealed that a foreign national had given him $1,000 as commission to take him to India.

340.title: Shocking incident: Thai PM as 34 people killed in shooting at daycare
340.article_body: Thailand PM Prayut Chan-o-cha called the mass shooting at a daycare centre on Thursday that killed at least 34 people, including 22 children, a "shocking incident". The PM has ordered all agencies to urgently treat the wounded. The gunman was a former police officer and he reportedly took his own life following the shooting in Nong Bua Lamphu province.

341.title: WhatsApp's Beta update blocks screenshots of 'View Once' messages
341.article_body: In its latest Android Beta update, WhatsApp has introduced a feature that enables blocking screenshots and screen recordings of 'View Once' messages. CEO Mark Zuckerberg said, "'View once' is already...popular way to share photos...that don't need to have a permanent digital record. Now WhatsApp is enabling screenshot blocking for 'View Once' messages for an added layer of protection."

342.title: Cong stoops to new low: BJP leader over Udit Raj's 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez
342.article_body: BJP leader Shehzad Poonawalla criticised Congress leader Udit Raj over the latter's "chamchagiri" remark on President Droupadi Murmu. "Ajoy Kumar called President Droupadi Murmu as evil and then Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury used the term 'Rashtrapatni', now Congress stoops to a new low!" Poonawalla tweeted. "Udit Raj uses unacceptable language for the first woman Adivasi President," he added.

343.title: 2 arrested for stealing phones worth ₹70 lakh from Hyd Bajaj store
343.article_body: The Rachakonda Police has arrested two persons who allegedly stole as many as 432 cellphones worth ₹70 lakh from a Bajaj Electronics store in Hyderabad in September. Police found three persons wearing face masks entering the store in CCTV footage. The main accused was arrested from Jharkhand's Sahibganj district, while another from West Bengal.

344.title: Batters are to be blamed: Pak Women captain Maroof after defeat vs Thailand
344.article_body: After suffering their first-ever defeat against Thailand in women's T20I history, Pakistan captain Bismah Maroof said their batters are to be blamed for the loss in their Asia Cup match. "Our batters [didn't show] intent...130+ could've been a good total and as a captain, I'm disappointed," added Maroof. Thailand restricted Pakistan to 116/5 and won the match by four wickets.

345.title: 'Ekk Deewana Tha' was mistake, shouldn't have done it: Director
345.article_body: Filmmaker Gautham Vasudev Menon, who directed 'Ekk Deewana Tha', said the 2012 film was a mistake. The film was a remake of the Tamil film 'Vinnaithaandi Varuvaayaa'. Gautham stated the original film was "naturally organic film". Speaking about making a remake of it, he said, "I shouldn't have done that...Somebody asked me 'Did you direct 'Ekk Deewana Tha'?'...I said no."

346.title: UAPA invoked against 15 PFI activists arrested during NIA raids in B'luru
346.article_body: Bengaluru City Police invoked the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) against 15 Popular Front of India (PFI) activists. The accused were arrested on September 22 following raids by the National Investigation Agency (NIA). "UAPA has been invoked in the case against the accused on account of the involvement of a few in crimes in the past," police said.

347.title: 4 men hit 3 policemen with car, beat them with rods in Gurugram hospital
