347.article_body: Three police personnel were injured after a group of four men attacked them in a private hospital in Gurugram, officials said on Wednesday. The accused tried to hit them with their car and later beat them with sticks and iron rods, police said. Police reached the hospital after a brawl broke out when the accused refused to pay for medicines.

348.title: 11-yr-old gets trapped inside lift in Gr Noida, rescued after 45 mins
348.article_body: An 11-year-old boy got trapped inside a lift in Greater Noida's Paramount Emotions society for almost 45 minutes before he was rescued by his parents. CCTV footage of the kid playing inside the lift went viral on social media, in which the boy can be seen pushing the lift buttons and inserting a bottle in between the lift doors.

349.title: I'm sitting with my grandfather & talking about periods, it's progress: Navya
349.article_body: Navya Naveli Nanda said it's a sign of progress as she discussed menstruation on a public forum in the presence of her grandfather Amitabh Bachchan. "It's a sign of life...That's not something...we should be ashamed of, or shy away from," she stated. "Menstruation has been a taboo for a long time, but there has been progress," said Navya.

350.title: Wife expressing desire to work after marriage isn't cruelty: Bombay HC
350.article_body: The Bombay High Court has ruled that if a wife expresses a desire to go to work after marriage, it would not amount to cruelty. The HC said this while dismissing a man's plea for divorce on grounds of cruelty. "The marital life should be accessed as a whole and few isolated instances....will not amount to cruelty," the court added.

351.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
351.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued heavy to very heavy rainfall warning for several states/UTs till October 10. Uttarakhand, Uttar Pradesh, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya may witness it across the next four days. It is very likely over Haryana, Chandigarh, Delhi and Maharashtra on October 8 and 9. Gujarat may witness it from October 8 to 10.

352.title: US believes Ukrainians behind killing of Russian nationalist's daughter: Report
352.article_body: United States intelligence agencies believe that parts of Ukrainian government were behind a car bomb attack that killed Darya Dugina, daughter of Russian President Vladimir Putin's ally, Alexander Dugin, the New York Times reported. It mentioned that US took no part in the attack and was not aware of it. Russia had accused Ukraine's secret service of orchestrating the attack.

353.title: Gujarat govt launches scheme to attract ₹12.5 trillion investments
353.article_body: Gujarat Chief Minister Bhupendra Patel unveiled a scheme for attracting investment of ₹12.50 trillion and creating at least 15 lakh jobs in the next five years under Aatmanirbhar Gujarat Schemes for Assistance to Industries. Patel said that the scheme is aimed at encouraging youth to innovate and become job creators as well as de-risking their investments through incentives.

354.title: Rahul kneels down to tie Sonia Gandhi's shoelaces during Bharat Jodo Yatra, pic viral
354.article_body: Congress chief Sonia Gandhi joined the Karnataka leg of the Bharat Jodo Yatra on Thursday. Congress MP Shashi Tharoor shared a photo on Twitter showing Rahul Gandhi kneeling next to his mother Sonia Gandhi to tie her shoelaces during the yatra in Karnataka. Tharoor wrote, "Even if she breathes, it also has prayers, Mothers do not break, mothers are mothers!"

355.title: Thailand defeat Pak in a women's T20I for 1st time ever, celebration video goes viral
355.article_body: Thailand defeated Pakistan by four wickets in the league stage of Women's Asia Cup T20 2022 on Thursday. With this, they registered their first-ever victory against Pakistan in women's T20I cricket history. Thailand restricted Pakistan for 116/5 and chased down the target in 19.5 overs. A video of their celebration has gone viral on social media.

356.title: Bihar man detained after threat to 'blow up' Antilia, kill Ambanis
356.article_body: Mumbai Police have detained a man from Bihar in connection with threat calls to Reliance Industries Chairman Mukesh Ambani's family. On Wednesday, two calls were received at Sir HN Reliance Foundation Hospital in Mumbai, threatening to blow up the hospital and Ambani's residence Antilia. The caller also threatened to kill Mukesh Ambani, Nita Ambani, Akash Ambani & Anant Ambani.

357.title: World's currency reserves shrink by a record $1 trillion this year
357.article_body: The global foreign-currency reserves have declined by about $1 trillion, or 7.8%, this year to $12 trillion, the biggest drop since Bloomberg began keeping a record in 2003. The decline comes amid the central banks of India and the Czech Republic's intervention to support their own currencies. India's reserves have slumped by $96 billion this year to $538 billion.

358.title: Persistent Systems gains after JPMorgan upgrades stock to 'overweight'
358.article_body: After brokerage house JPMorgan upgraded the call on shares of Persistent Systems Limited to 'overweight' from 'neutral', its stock gained on Thursday. JPMorgan gave a revised target price of ₹4,100 apiece. The Pune-headquartered company is JPMorgan's only 'overweight' within the Engineering, Research and Development space. At 1:52 pm, its shares were trading 6.81% higher at ₹3,522 on the BSE.

359.title: Man's Apple Watch overheats, makes crackling sounds and then explodes
359.article_body: An Apple Watch Series 7 overheated, made "crackling sounds" and then "exploded" just as he was throwing it out the window, its owner claimed in a statement in 9to5Mac. The device's owner visited the emergency room because of lead poisoning concerns. Apple arranged a pickup for the affected device, saying it would take the device to its lab for investigation.

360.title: Pic of gunman who killed 34 people including 22 kids at Thailand daycare released
360.article_body: Thailand's Central Investigation Bureau has released a picture of the gunman, an ex-police officer, who killed 34 people including 22 kids at a daycare centre. Media reported that the gunman later shot and killed himself. Mass shootings are rare in Thailand even though the rate of gun ownership is high compared with some other countries in the region.

361.title: Poland says it's in talks to host US nuclear weapons amid Russia threat
361.article_body: Poland has spoken to the US about having NATO's nuclear weapons on its territory, Polish President Andrzej Duda said amid growing fears that Russian President Vladimir Putin could resort to using nuclear arms in Ukraine. However, deploying US nuclear weapons to Poland, a neighbour of Ukraine, could be a violation of NATO's Nuclear Non-Proliferation Treaty and the NATO-Russia Founding Act.

362.title: Prithvi Shaw's name should've been there for SA ODIs: Aakash Chopra
362.article_body: Reacting to Prithvi Shaw's omission from the three-match ODI series against South Africa, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said the 22-year-old's name should have been there in the squad. "I frankly see Shaw playing in the next T20 World Cup...Management should start inducting him and utilising him. His numbers are fantastic in domestic cricket," stated Aakash.

363.title: Virgin Atlantic halts London to Hong Kong flights after nearly 30 years
363.article_body: British airline Virgin Atlantic has decided to suspend Heathrow to Hong Kong service, shut its Hong Kong office after nearly 30 years of operation due to prolonged closure of Russian airspace. "Significant operational complexities due to the ongoing Russian airspace closure have contributed to the commercial decision not to resume flights in March 2023," airline founder Richard Branson said.

364.title: Won't allow screening of 'Adipurush': BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam
364.article_body: BJP spokesperson Ram Kadam has said that the screening of 'Adipurush' won't be allowed as it has "distorted the Hindu gods and goddesses". "Some film producers to earn publicity and money have this habit of distorting facts, but the Hindu society will not tolerate such things," he said. Previously, Madhya Pradesh Home Minister Narottam Mishra also raised objections against 'Adipurush'.

365.title: Australia proposes changes in privacy policy after Optus data breach
365.article_body: Australian government has proposed changes in consumer privacy rules after a data breach at the country's second-largest mobile operator, Optus, compromised personal details of almost 10 million customers. The amendment will let telcos share government-issued identification data with banks for enhanced monitoring for affected users. Banks will have to destroy data when it is no longer required.

366.title: India's services sector growth hit 6-month low in September: PMI
366.article_body: India's services sector activity fell to a six-month low in September at 54.3, the S&P Global India Services Purchasing Managers' Index (PMI) showed. "September also saw a broad stabilisation of input cost inflation...slowest upturn in prices charged for the provision of services since March," Economics Associate Director Pollyanna De Lima noted. In August, PMI stood at 57.2.

367.title: Reflects their anti-tribal mindset: Sambit Patra on Cong leader's remark on Prez
367.article_body: BJP leader Sambit Patra criticised Congress leader Udit Raj over the latter's "chamchagiri" remark for President Droupadi Murmu. "Words used for President Murmu by Congress leader…[are] worrisome, unfortunate," Patra said. "This isn't the first time they have used such words. Congress' Adhir Ranjan Chowdhury did it too. This reflects their anti-tribal mindset," he added.

368.title: 11-yr-old girl watching garba dies in MP, CT scan shows bullet in head
368.article_body: An 11-year-old girl collapsed and started bleeding profusely while watching garba in Madhya Pradesh's Indore on Tuesday, said police. She was taken to a hospital where she died. According to the victim's father, the doctor suggested a CT scan, which showed a bullet-like metallic object in her skull. Based on the post-mortem report, police said a bullet had hit her.

369.title: 31 people including kids killed in mass shooting at daycare centre in Thailand
369.article_body: At least 31 people including kids have been killed in a mass shooting at a pre-school daycare centre in Thailand, police said. Police added that the attacker, an ex-police officer, shot and stabbed children and adults and is now on the run. Prime Minister Prayut Chan-o-cha has alerted all agencies to take action and apprehend the culprit, a spokesperson said.

370.title: Fix for wheel issue that caused electric car recall found: Toyota
370.article_body: Toyota Motor said it has found a fix for the defect because of which it had to recall several units of its first electric vehicle in June. The carmaker recalled 2,700 bZ4X sports utility crossovers globally due to a risk of wheels coming loose. Toyota said it would ensure hub bolts were replaced and properly tightened in new cars.

371.title: Cong leader Udit Raj clarifies 'chamchagiri' remark on Prez, calls it his personal view
371.article_body: Congress leader Udit Raj on Thursday said his remarks on President Droupadi Murmu accusing her of "chamchagiri" were personal and didn't represent his party's views. "My statement...is mine & [has] nothing to do with Congress," part of his tweet read. He had earlier accused her of "chamchagiri" after she said "the salt produced in Gujarat is consumed by all Indians".

372.title: 'Bhoot Police' likely to get a sequel, confirms Saif Ali Khan
372.article_body: Saif Ali Khan has confirmed that the makers of 'Bhoot Police' are "very keen to do a sequel". The film, which had a direct-to-OTT release in 2021, starred Saif with Arjun Kapoor, Jacqueline Fernandez and Yami Gautam. "I liked my role in Bhoot Police. It continues to be one of the most watched films on that [OTT] platform," Saif said.

373.title: Gujarat youth slashes girl's face after asking if she had an affair
373.article_body: A youth allegedly slashed a 14-year-old girl's face in Gujarat's Surat after asking if she had an affair with someone. Although the girl replied in negative, he attacked her with a knife. The victim had to undergo surgery and got 17 stitches. According to the victim's mother, the accused had been harassing her daughter for the past three months.

374.title: Sydney records wettest year since records began in 1858
374.article_body: Australia's Sydney has recorded its wettest year since records first began in 1858. Sydney has received about 2,213 mm of rainfall since January, surpassing the previous record of 2,194 mm set in 1950, official data showed. In the past two years, floods have struck Sydney's suburbs three times, forcing tens of thousands of people to flee their homes.

375.title: 66 clinics halted abortions in 15 US states after Roe vs Wade overturned: Report
375.article_body: At least 66 clinics in 15 US states have stopped providing abortions since the country's Supreme Court overturned Roe vs Wade that guaranteed abortion rights to American women, according to the Guttmacher Institute. The number of clinics providing abortions in the 15 states dropped from 79 before June to 13 as of October, all of which are in Georgia.

376.title: Fan breaks down on meeting Dwayne Johnson, actor shares video
376.article_body: Dwayne Johnson shared a video in which a fan couldn't hold back his tears on meeting the Hollywood actor and former wrestler. The video shows Dwayne signing a WWE Championship belt for the fan. "Even my cold, dark soul gets a little emotional when I see people start to break and cry," the actor wrote along with the video.

377.title: Vijay Nair sent to judicial custody till Oct 20 in Delhi liquor policy case
377.article_body: Delhi's Rouse Avenue court has sent the former CEO of event management firm Only Much Louder (OML), Vijay Nair, to judicial custody till October 20 in a Delhi liquor policy case. He was arrested for his alleged role in the irregularities pertaining to the excise policy. Notably, Nair is the communications in-charge of the Aam Aadmi Party.

378.title: We will not rely on others for defence: Taiwan Prez
378.article_body: Taiwanese President Tsai Ing-wen on Wednesday said that Taiwan will not rely on others for its defence. "Taiwan is fully committed to protecting our security...We're also working to adapt our defence strategy to the changing threats we face," she added. China claims democratically-governed Taiwan as its own territory and has vowed to take the island by force if necessary.

379.title: No country should get Prez like Murmu, 'chamchagiri' has its limits: Cong leader
379.article_body: Congress' Udit Raj said "no country should get President like Droupadi Murmu". "Chamchagiri also has its limits. She says 70% of people eat Gujarat's salt. If you live life by eating salt yourself, you'll know," he tweeted. Earlier, President said Gujarat produces 76% of country's salt and it can be said "salt produced in state is consumed by all Indians".

380.title: Rahkeem Cornwall smashes 205* off 77 balls, including 22 sixes, in 20-over match in US
380.article_body: West Indian all-rounder Rahkeem Cornwall smashed an unbeaten 205 off 77 deliveries, including 22 sixes and 17 fours, while representing Atlanta Fire against Square Drive in an Atlanta Open 2022 match. His knock helped his team post a total of 326/1 in their 20 overs. Atlanta Fire went on to win the match by 172 runs.

381.title: India's tallest flag, higher than Pak flag, to be installed at Wagah-Attari border
381.article_body: The country's tallest flag at 418 feet is set to be installed at the Wagah-Attari border by the National Highways Authority of India, an official said. The present 360-feet high flag was installed in March 2017, following which Pakistan had hoisted a taller flag at Wagah check post. The new Tricolour will be 18 feet longer than the Pakistani flag.

382.title: SpaceX launches 52 Starlink satellites hours after launching Crew-5 mission
382.article_body: SpaceX launched 52 Starlink satellites seven hours after launching members of the Crew-5 mission to the space station on Wednesday. The satellites lifted off atop a Falcon 9 rocket from California's Vandenberg Space Force Base. They were deployed about 62 minutes after liftoff. SpaceX now plans to launch the Intelsat G-33/G-34 mission on October 6.

383.title: Harish Kalyan announces engagement to Narmada Udayakumar, shares pics
383.article_body: Tamil actor Harish Kalyan took to his social media accounts to introduce his fiancee Narmada Udayakumar. Announcing his engagement with Narmada, Harish shared that the two will soon tie the knot. "As we embark on a new life journey to explore and reinvent ourselves together, we seek double the blessings and love from you all, now and always," he wrote.

384.title: Apollo, Sixth Street end talks to finance Musk's Twitter deal: Report
384.article_body: Apollo Global Management and Sixth Street have ended talks with Tesla's Elon Musk to finance his Twitter deal, Reuters reported citing sources. Apollo had been looking at ways to support the deal earlier, while Sixth Street investors were looking at providing about $1 billion. Musk has once again proposed to buy Twitter after backing out of a $44-billion deal earlier.

385.title: Former Uber security chief guilty of concealing 2016 data breach
385.article_body: Former Uber security chief Joseph Sullivan has been found guilty of criminal obstruction by a San Francisco jury for concealing a data breach in 2016 from the FTC. Sullivan "worked to hide" the breach from FTC and "took steps to prevent the hackers from being caught", Attorney Stephanie Hinds said. The breach exposed data of 57 million passengers and drivers.

386.title: BMC gives ₹10 cr each to 24 wards for beautification, repair projects
386.article_body: Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has disbursed ₹10 crore each to all the 24 municipal wards for beautification and repair projects. "BMC has earmarked a total fund of ₹30.5 crore for each ward for carrying out the beautification and repair work on priority. It has disbursed ₹10 crore to complete the pending work, mainly micro-level, at the earliest," an official said.

387.title: Ban 'Adipurush', Lord Ram wrongly depicted in the film: Ayodhya Ram Temple head priest
387.article_body: The head priest of the Ayodhya Ram Temple on Wednesday demanded an immediate ban on the movie 'Adipurush', over the alleged wrong depiction of Lord Ram, Hanuman and Ravana. Making a film is not a crime but they should not be made to create deliberate controversies to hog the limelight, chief priest Satyendra Das said.

388.title: World's oldest dog passes away aged 22
388.article_body: World's oldest dog, Pebbles, passed away from natural causes at her home in Taylors, South Carolina, US with her owners Bobby and Julie Gregory by her side, Guinness World Records said. The Toy Fox Terrier was born on March 28, 2000, in Long Island, New York. Pebbles birthed 32 puppies across three different litters with her late partner, Rocky.

389.title: I see Deepak Chahar being Bumrah's replacement at the T20 WC: Jaffer
389.article_body: Former India cricketer Wasim Jaffer has said he sees pacer Deepak Chahar being Jasprit Bumrah's replacement for Team India in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "Deepak is getting to play and he is going to play again in the ODIs and it makes sense...He is a quality new-ball bowler, and I do not think he lacks variation," stated Jaffer.

390.title: Tejashwi reaches Medanta Hospital to check on Mulayam Singh's health
390.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Wednesday reached Gurugram’s Medanta Hospital to enquire about former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's health. "There is some improvement in his health. He is in CCU. Met with Akhilesh Yadav and gave him my best wishes," Tejashwi Yadav said. Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar also visited the hospital yesterday to check on Singh's health.

391.title: Ramayan inspires people to protect all living beings: UP CM Yogi
391.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Wednesday said the Ramayan inspires people to protect all living beings, as the CM fed milk to a leopard cub at Gorakhpur’s Shaheed Ashfaq Ullah Khan Zoological Park. Speaking on the occasion, CM Yogi said human beings will be safe only when they are aware of their responsibilities towards the nature and conservation of animals.

392.title: 2 electrocuted to death in Durga Puja pandal in UP's Barabanki
392.article_body: Two people, including a 17-year-old boy, were electrocuted to death in a Durga Puja pandal in Uttar Pradesh's Barabanki on Wednesday, said police. Several other people also received electric shocks. The incident occurred after a wire supplying electricity to the pandal was damaged, according to a villager. The bodies have been sent for post-mortem.

393.title: JSW Energy gains after Maharashtra MoU for hydro pumped storage project
393.article_body: After JSW Energy's wholly-owned subsidiary JSW Neo Energy entered into a Memorandum of Understanding with Maharashtra to set up a hydro pumped storage project (PSP) in the state, JSW Energy stock surged on Thursday. It will set up a 960 MW capacity hydro PSP. At 11:45 am, the company's stock was trading 11.85% higher at ₹328 apiece on the NSE.

394.title: Girl raped, murdered in UP's Mainpuri
394.article_body: A girl was allegedly raped and murdered in the Nagla Shisham village of Uttar Pradesh's Mainpuri district, police said on Wednesday. The victim's younger sister saw the body hanging in the house through the window after returning from coaching. She said a person named Pushpendra strangled her sister to death. Their parents were away at the time of the incident.

395.title: Myanmar jails Japanese filmmaker for 10 years for violating laws
395.article_body: A court in military-ruled Myanmar has jailed a 26-year-old Japanese documentary filmmaker, Toru Kubota, for 10 years over violation of sedition and telecommunications laws, a Japanese Foreign Ministry official said. Kubota was arrested in July at a protest in Myanmar's Yangon. A court hearing on allegations of violation of the immigration control law will be held on October 12.

396.title: 26-year-old man arrested with mephedrone worth ₹1.04 lakh in Pune
396.article_body: Pune City Police arrested a 26-year-old man, who works at the shop of a cloth trader, with 6.9 grams of banned drug mephedrone worth ₹1.04 lakh. This comes after police received a tip-off that a man was trying to sell mephedrone in the Dhankawadi area. "We are looking at the supply chain and distribution network of the suspect," police said.

397.title: Sushmita Sen shares pic showing her look as transgender activist Gauri Sawant
397.article_body: Actress Sushmita Sen has announced her next web series, 'Taali', where she will play transgender activist Gauri Sawant. "Nothing makes me prouder & more grateful than to have the privilege of portraying this beautiful person & of bringing her story to the world!!" she wrote while sharing her look on Instagram. Marathi filmmaker Ravi Jadhav will direct the series.

398.title: Dean was in tears, Indian team didn't even look her in the eye: Anderson on mankading
398.article_body: England pacer James Anderson has said he doesn't see mankading as a "legitimate dismissal" and termed it a "sneaky way of getting someone out". Talking about the controversy over India's Deepti Sharma mankading England's Charlotte Dean, Anderson said, "They did not even look Dean in the eye." He added, "If there was guilt about the dismissal, then don't do it."

399.title: Mayor, 17 others dead as gunmen attack town in southern Mexico
399.article_body: At least 18 people have been killed after gunmen wearing ski masks opened fire in a municipal hall and a house in San Miguel Totolapan town in southern Mexico on Wednesday, local media reported. Among those killed were town's Mayor Conrado Mendoza and his father, Juan Mendoza, a former Mayor. Photos online showed the hall riddled with bullet holes.

400.title: EPF subscribers can't see interest due to software upgrade: Finance Ministry
400.article_body: The Finance Ministry clarified on Wednesday that Employees' Provident Fund Organisation (EPFO) subscribers haven't suffered any loss of interest rate. "The interest is being credited in the accounts of all EPF subscribers. However, that is not visible in the statements in view of a software upgrade being implemented by EPFO to account for change in the tax incidence," it tweeted.

401.title: Adult toys found in briefcase that caused bomb scare in Japan
401.article_body: Adult toys were found in a briefcase that caused a bomb scare in Japan's Kakegawa. Police received a call on Wednesday morning about the unattended briefcase in the parking lot of a municipal cemetery, a spokesman said. Local media sent a helicopter to capture the work of the experts at the scene.

402.title: Chiranjeevi's 'GodFather' earns over ₹38 crore worldwide on first day
402.article_body: The team of 'GodFather' announced on Thursday that the film has collected over ₹38 crore at the worldwide box office on the first day of its release. The Mohan Raja directorial, which released on October 5, is a Telugu remake of Malayalam film 'Lucifer'. While the original movie starred Mohanlal in the lead role, the Telugu film features Chiranjeevi.
